description:
When I came in with my lovely tiny girlfriend,  the cool Asian guy with the beard was happy to help us.  He reminded me of my cousin Jeremy but younger.  That's cool.  The burger was good but I got my self a root beer float;  and even though I'm lactose intolerant I drank it anyway... and it was good.  ( I mean I'll hate myself later but it's not their fault).  The burger was descent and made to order.  I like fries extra crispy if you have thicker fries... maybe years on the line have made me like the crunchier ones... but I digress.

A burger joint in walking distance is good.  And friendly people are good too.  I would have said the cool guy who served us name but alas,  no name tag.   Soo, all in all a descent burger.  She had a portobello mushroom burger and the coleslaw... she quite enjoyed both...

Ok 11 burger is kinda pricy for other cities but in this city everything is expensive.... so that's cheap? Sure.  It seems like a nice place to get a burger and a beer.
author: Ashes W.

description:
Woke up and was starving! I had to wait for the roommate to get up, but when he did, he wanted burgers. We decided to try Burgermeister for brunch / lunch. We placed our delivery order on Sunday, December 10th at 12:38pm via DoorDash. Our order arrived at 1:49pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*12 Wings: Buffalo Wings, Lemon Pepper Wings, Ranch ($13)
*Firehouse Burger: Fried egg, jalapeños, pepper jack cheese, red pepper aioli, jalapeño cilantro mayo, brioche bun, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pickle, Medium ($15.50), Onion Rings (+$4.50)
*Meisterburger: Avocado, thick-cut bacon, sautéed mushrooms, grilled onions, cheese, jalapeño, cilantro mayo, house bun, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pickle, Medium ($15.50), Garlic Fries (+$3.50)
*Chili Cheese Dog: Chili, nacho cheese, onions, shredded cheddar, parsley ($10.50)

The wings had decent flavor. Though they were a little small in size. Not the big, plump, juicy wings I'm prefer. I got the meisterburger which was pretty good. A lot going on with all the toppings, but it melded into a comforting bite. The garlic fries were a little disappointing. Just regular fries topped with garlic bits. If you just ate the fry by itself, it tasted like a regular french fry. I liked the roomie's firehouse burger better as the egg gave it more moisture. Their chili has beans, so I didn't really try the hot dog. Good to note, the dog does come with regular fries. I did wish they gave us the same upgrade option as the burgers as I would have liked to vary our sides. Their regular fries are just meh.

Pretty good burgers, though rather pricey at $15+ each. At least it was a lot of food and managed to feed us 1.5 times. Glad I finally tried Burgermeister, but I think there are better burger spots out there. And for about half the price!
author: Elena N.

description: Delicious, juicy burger. Everything tasted really fresh from bun to crispy lengthwise sliced pickles. Fries were also very good, crispy on the outside and served hot. Staff was very friendly. Decor is the usual quick lunch place, red vinyl covered stools and chairs. Nothing fancy, but the place was pleasant and clean. It was a comfortable spot to sit and read a book while having a burger. I imagine it is much busier during the week and later in the day. Nice clean bathroom, too. Easy hop off the J Church.
author: Rabbit C.

description:
After a night of happy hour libations, I wanted to grab a nice juicy burger to help with the hunger. My friend suggested this place as it was close by the bar we last visited. It also helped that it was one of the only burger joints open at that time so that was a no brainer. 

I like the bold red and yellow colors that give it the diner feel. Lots of awards and publications framed on the walls throughout the location. There were different types of seating throughout the joint and a self service condiment bar which I'm always a fan of. Walk up to the counter, order and find a seat; the kitchen will deliver your food when it's ready. Simple process. 

For my first visit, I decided on the classic Cheeseburger for $10.75. All burgers come with fries, tomatoes, onions, lettuce and pickles. I decided to add on curly fries instead of the normal french fries. I'm glad I did. Their seasoned curly fries were so crispy and flavorful; reminded me of Jack in the Box curly fries which can NEVER do wrong in my eyes. The curly fries alone will keep me coming back! The burger was good too! Juicy and cooked to a medium rare perfection, I chose American cheese. The overall burger was big and filling. 

Yeah, this place certainly not THE BEST burger joint out there but for what it is, they do it right! I'll continue coming back here because of the simplicity of ingredients and flavor of their food. Come check them out!
author: Rockne H.

description: Simple burger joint. We ordered the bacon cheeseburger, fries, and the chili which all were above average. It's a nice quick place to stop by when craving for burgers and fries.
author: Christina L.

description: This has been my #1 Burger spot -- and Bay Area "franchise" -- for over 10 years...until recently, that is. Their choice of bun (which has that plastic-like surface texture & too much bread) + their overly greasy fries (perhaps not frying at right temperature?) has bumped them off my list all together. It seems that gone are the days simple and delicious Burgermeister. I'll light a food candle and hope they make a ferocious comeback akin to where they were 10+ years ago.
author: Carlos H.

description: Food was pretty good. We got a burger and chicken strips. The man who rang us up was very friendly and seemed liked he enjoyed his job. Give them a try. I would just say that the prices are a little high- but that's expected in the city
author: Alex S.

description: I just paid about $15 for the worst fish & chips ever. Three small pieces of fish with overcooked batter & foul tasting fries. Also a manky leaf of inedible & unappetising lettuce. I ate as much of it as I could stomach, because I wasn't going to go hungry after buying it & taking it home. If I'd been eating in the restaurant I would've complained. I should've photographed the fish too but the fries literally looked mouldy. Not sure I'll ever go back again.
author: Kym S.

description: I have always enjoyed Burgermeister. I think they are some of the best burgers in the Bay Area. I don't write as many reviews as I should, but this review is specifically for the cashier, Chet! We were super hungry before we all planned to go out drinking (my best friend was in town) and I hate doing that but we ended up there and even though they were closing up he was so nice and hospitable! As someone who works in service I get how frustrating it can be to have people coming in right as your closing but he was seriously great. We weren't the only group in there and he was super great to all of us. The cook always cranked everything out really fast and it was delicious. Go here for all your burger needs!
author: Hannah G.

description:
Been coming here for years. Would normally give it a 4, but my last couple visits are 2 at best. This last, I came at opening. The cashier didn't seem he could be bothered. The french fries were grease all the way through, over done. I looked like thru put thawed old fries on the fryer. The 'medium rare' burger was well done at best. Not sure why they asked. The bun was soggy. Actually, it very much looked and tasted like it was premade and warmed over. When I ordered, the cashier said 15 min wait. It took 5. I pretty sure the fries and burger were done earlier and then just redone when I ordered. 

When I started worrying this review, I put 3, but the more I think about it, that meal was being unacceptable. Shifted it to 1. I'll Try in the future one more time. Maybe it was a one off. 

And country music? Ugh. (Doesn't factor in the rating, just seems a word choice in this establishment in this city)
author: Trey L.

description:
This time you get a 2-star the first time I give you a five-star because the food was off the hook it was really good the service was great,but this time I don't know what happened !? :( 
 Then I just called my bank and they charged me extra $21 when they made a mistake I'm like oh hell no then didn't cook the burger how I wanted it then they mixed in old with new fries! Who does that?! and then you left my food on the counter when you should bring it to me.
 (oh hell no!) And I asked for a crisp bacon and then it wasn't even Crisping and he goes well take your food back we do it over  I'm like no it's too late now (WTFF!)
I definitely won't be coming back the only reason why I'll be back here is to say give me the 21 cash or you call the bank,and tell them you made a mistake because I just called,  and you overcharged me because I have a receipt here it didn't cost no $35
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Food was a 3/5. Maybe I expect high quality food from places in SF, but for $14 a burger, it should be fantastic. Got a turkey burger and garlic fries. The fries were drenched in oil (i.e., translucent) and the turkey patty was low to medium quality. The wheat bun seemed medium to high quality but was so much bread, it dwarfed the thin turkey patty and toppings. Thankfully the lettuce and tomato was fresh. What dropped it down to two stars was 1) the hair I found in my fries and 2) both me and my partner had stomach aches leaving the restaurant-- and I only ate half of my food. 

Will likely never return-- and will stay away from ALL chains, forever.
author: Charlene B.

description: The burgers here are good. But unfortunately the cashier act's as if  we were  bothering him. He has the personality of a pair of shoes I hadn't seen in my closet for years.
author: Kenny M.

description: Great place for an amazing burger. They have a build your own option with so many toppings and condiments. The burger my husband got was huge and the garlic fries were amazing. Quick service and the food tastes super fresh! Prices were a little high but in the end worth it!
author: Eva R.

description: We've been coming to this Burgermeister for years, and have always loved it.  It was our "go to" burger place. But the menu has recently been revamped, and not for the better.  Our to-go meal tonight was just barely ok, and was really a disappointment compared to the past. The serving size of the fries was about half of what it used to be. Seriously, when we opened things up at home, it looked like somebody had eaten half our fries.  I counted mine. There were only 15 in my order, and many of them were only partial fries (fry fragments? :-) a few inches long.  Very sad, lonely fries.  Not even McDonald's caliber. On top of that, the fries that were there were greasy, soggy, and not quite thoroughly cooked.  Burgers were just ok . . . buns were on the dry side, not toasted or warmed at all, too thick, too much bread, and didn't seem totally fresh.  Burgers themselves were also on the dry side, and pretty bland. No excuse for that at $14+ for a burger. They also used to have a really great condiment counter where you could get all sorts of saucy extras -- several kinds of mustard, mayo, ketchup, bbq sauce, A-1, and more, served from nice, very clean stainless steel dispensers with nice clean pump handles, with the little plastic cups and lids right there.  Now, all the dispensers are gone (except one for mustard), and instead there are a few bottles of things across the room on the counter, near the cashier, in plastic squeeze bottles, with a handwritten piece of tape on them indicating what they are. The little plastic cups and lids, however, are on the other side of the room . . . so you have to do a lot of walking back and forth.  And the condiment squeeze bottles themselves were sticky and gross, having been handled by a few hundred people every day.  Not either appetizing or appealing, and undoubtedly not hygienic either.  You have to actually ask for mayonnaise, and when I asked for an extra one, I really got the feeling I was pushing things. Anyway, what a disappointment.  Really used to love this place.  The food, the set-up, everything used to be totally together, and the burgers were great. Not the case anymore, with (sadly) the food itself having taken a real dive. There are much better places to get great high-end "artisan" burgers in a foodie town. Yes, there are still a bunch of interesting high-quality cheeses, and other toppings available here. That hasn't changed. But honestly, the burger itself was less than average, and in terms of the actual burger quality, tastiness, seasoning, juiciness -- and also the taste and quality of the fries -- In-N-Out Burger is a LOT more enjoyable, and at $10 less per burger.
author: George D.

description: I used to go to this place frequently.  I went there for dinner yesterday and was surprised by their total revamping of their menu.  I ordered the chicken strips and fries.  What a disappointment!   The chicken strips were over cooked and the fries were extremely greasy.  They were in no way like the chicken strips and fries they used to make.  I can no longer recommend this restaurant
author: David G.

description: Awesome spot with caring folks the burgers are absolutely amazing. Make sure to tell Francis toks says hi
author: Tokunbo E.

description: Hubby and I found this gem randomly while scouring for food. We spotted the flashy sign a few blocks away and couldn't help but walk to it, luckily for us they did not disappoint. The cashier was extremely friendly and even came to check on us after we had ordered. The restaurant looked really nice, cool decor and good music. The burgers were AMAZING!! I got the mushroom Swiss burger medium rare and was in love at first bite! The fries are delicious as well, and to top it off they also had Dijon mustard to dip them in to :) Needless to say we left happily full and can't wait to go back again!
author: Meg B.

description:
3.5 stars

They have a pretty extensive menu here - you can either build your own burger or pick from the specialty menu. I like that the buns are toasted and the patties have a subtle, charred taste. A bit overpriced though, ranging from $12 - $15 for a burger, and the restaurant itself is pretty dirty. The tables are diner style, not particularly cohering to any kind of ambience. It is self serve - order at the counter and throw away your own trash - but they don't wipe off the tables very often, and with burgers it gets greasy really quickly. Fries are good though! Super crispy!

Overall, the burgers are decent, especially if you're looking to have things like avocado or blue cheese on it. However, being cleaner, more rustic looking, and better priced, Super Duper would be my choice over Burgermeister!
author: Tiffany P.

description: The burger was not as good as i hoped... the bun was Huge and dry. It was a veggie burger but i have had a good veggie burger and they do exist. The whole meal was subpar and dry. The restroom was very dirty and grimy. The menu has many other options but until they can clean up i don't think i will be going back to even try anything else. Sorry, not sorry.
author: L'a Tricia S.

description:
Obsessed. Can't stop eating here. Have a burger once a week every week.  
The plainer the better because the basics... meat cheese and bun are delicious!!!!! BEST IN SF. I'm a huge burger snob.
author: Haley J.

description:
Those burgers were good ! We tried the ABC and the San Francisco burger
It's around $15 a person 
Good meat 
And enough seating for small groups

The workers are really nice and friendly
author: Jad A.

description:
Just okay. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again. Got a cheeseburger and fries for lunch. Asked for it cooked medium and it actually was. Fries were crisp. Patty was a bit thin for my liking. Service was kind. $10 budget and fries. 

It's a step up from fast food. Not sure where they source their beef from. I still prefer Super Duper for flavor and quality.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Wanna a good burger.  This is the place. No frills burger are waiting for you.   It's cash only but who cares 

And the staff are so sweet.
author: Mark S.

description:
Delicious food. I ordered the California (medium). It was cooked perfectly and the meat was juicy and well seasoned. The fries were good old fashioned French fries, no complaints there.

The portions will leave you very satisfied and the prices will not leave you broke.

I can't wait to go back and try some of their other items!! See u soon!
author: Rudy S.

description: A decent burger similar to what you could get a diner. I'm glad you get to pick the patty's doneness. The crinkle cut sweet potato fries were great.
author: Huey N.

description:
3.5 stars

With lent pretty much taking away sweets and desserts from me until Easter, my body was in need of something bad -- like only oil and salt can fulfill after cocktails at nearby Churchill. 

A half pound of Niman ranch beef patty between two sesame seed buns and melted cheddar did the trick. But after two bites of the burger, I handed it to the bf so I can focus (and finish!) the mountain of GARLIC FRIES.  So good, very greasy and they pile on the garlic! 

How garlicky? So garlicky that I was still burping garlic the next day. Yum.
author: Janice C.

description:
Meh. I mean you know what you're getting when you come here. The location is good, and there aren't many options when you're craving fries and a burger, so you deal with everything else. You deal with Burgermeister being on the expensive side for what they offer. You deal with the "restaurant"? not feeling clean at all, from the moment you step in it. The tables don't seem clean, the floor doesn't seem like it's ever been cleaned, the aprons the people cooking your food are wearing don't seem clean. You deal in the moment, hoping that the craving doesn't return and you won't have to go back. 

Why is their service bad? It's the kind of place where you can call your order in ahead, arrive, talk to the cashier, and know that your order is only JUST THEN being put in. It's the kind of place where requests for more ketchup or sauce are just forgotten so you have to wait and then repeat yourself. It's the kind of place where seeing the cashier crawl around the floor on his hands and knees looking for God only knows what, isn't that surprising. But you're still grossed out when he uses those same hands to hand you your box of food.

I guess the food gets 3 stars, but their service & cleanliness are atrocious so that knocks them down.
author: Sara H.

description:
3.5 stars realistically, so the yelp average is pretty spot on!

The summary: VERY expensive (but pretty average) burgers and really nice staff.

We ordered two burgers and split them.  One was the Farm Burger and the other one was the Meisterburger.  They were both okay, but for the ingredients that they had on them, I expected them to pack more of a flavor punch.  I wasn't a fan of the bun either - it was mushy and didn't hold up well.

If you like five guys' style of burgers, you'll likely be a fan of this place, but sadly I'm just not really into this bun type.  My wallet also just wasn't very into the prices here..
author: Alyx F.

description:
The burger is kinda okay 
The bread is moist and kinda old, i felt like eating 
I dont think i'll go there again
author: Tasneem S.

description:
Let me start by saying that I've never had an issue with this place until today and I rarely write reviews unless I think it's necessary...

With that said, I tried calling in a take out order tonight.  The lady who took my call was incredibly rude.  She couldn't hear me (even tho I was literally trying to yell into my iPhone) and told me to "speak loudly and clearly into the phone"...um excuse me? I continued to try to order and as she asked for my name and phone I had to repeat myself 3 times until she said "I cannot hear you" in an incredibly rude way.  I hung up and called the other burgermeister on Carl street (who didn't have a problem understanding me).  If you can't give good customer service, you probably shouldn't be in the food industry.
author: Joanne R.

description:
Want a quick fix for a real burger? Hit this place up. 

Burgermeister has a history of using premium beef for its burgers, and when I went, the beef was definitely the shining attribute of the burger (and everything else was fiercely mediocre). However, I like the meat in my burgers to remind me that I'm currently chowing down on the 21st century version of what my ancestors hunted and died for - red meat. Juicy, hearty, and tender. 

Would go again.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I just deleted my past four-star review from April of last year. Why? Because when it's exactly opening time, and your sign says "open" in the front door, and the front door is unlocked, you don't get to bark at customers "We're closed!" when they enter your establishment.

I live a block away and eat out maybe 15 times per week. Guess they don't want any of my business. Seriously, couldn't have been more rude. We went to Chilango instead. And in the future, we'll go to any of the hundred restaurants in a five block radius that knows that you don't get to treat customers that way. Yeah. Door unlocked. Sign said open. What WERE we thinking?
author: Sean B.

description: I was sad.  The one in Westlake was 100 times better.  I asked for extremely well done and it was pink.  The lettuce had brown spots.  Blech.....never again.
author: Jaymi Marie P.

description:
Tried this place for the first time today around noon. Was a little apprehensive because the place was empty. However, the service was really good and the restaurant was very clean, especially for a small burger joint in sf. 

It's a little pricy but the food is good and filling. It's not extraordinary but very fresh and tasty. The fries were awesome and the vinaigrette dressing over the salad was way better than a lot of fancy restaurants. 

4 stars for service, cleanliness, portions, and awesome fries. Knocked off a star for prices.
author: Tara H.

description: This place is consistently delicious I come here fairly often about once a month. I usually get the wings(extra crispy) in bbq or buffalo and they're always done right. The burgers are good as well. It's your standard burger joint but they have way more to offer. An added bonus is that they have beer and wine. Come here on a Thursday and it's all day happy hour...Thirsty Thursdays and all their drinks are $3. All of the staff members are very attentive and pleasant to deal with. I recommend this place for a quick lunch.
author: Imani T.

description:
After a long afternoon taking the bus to Golden Gate Bridge and then struggling to get back (determining right bus and then dealing with nightmarish Friday night traffic...guess that's universal...*LOL*) and then having my phone die mid-walk across the bridge, I wound up getting back to my B&B home a little later.    I was too tired to venture anywhere beyond the general area and spied Burgermeister while walking back on Church that evening.   So after plugging my phone to charge and subsequently conversing with the bff briefly on my day, I walked over to the BM.

The cashier/server was busy chatting away with the cooks and another server.   One of the cooks alerted her to my presence and she quickly turned around and took my order.    She was really pleasant and it didn't seem like the "fake" kind that some customer service folks give you.    She made assumption at first that I wanted a custom burger but quickly self corrected when I mentioned wanting the mushroom and swiss.

I ordered the burger to go and she mentioned it would be ten minutes.   The time seemed shorter and she was really sweet through the whole process.   Customer service definitely gets 5 stars.

The burger itself was good.   It wasn't among the best but it did fill me up and the fries were aplenty, which is always a plus.
author: Eric G.

description:
First time going in here & it was an okay experience for me. The place was small/cramped but it's sorta expected in a city like SF. Lighting was dim but overall vibe was good. Workers there were all nice & friend so I decided to build my own burger. I got the Tilapia fillet with coleslaw, garlic curly fries, & a peppermint milkshake.

The milkshake was delish! It reminded me of the Red Robin shake I recently had & that's a good thing. The garlic curly fries was fried to perfection, crunchy with every bite, they don't become soggy if you dump ketchup over them, AND they used REAL GARLIC to put on top of the fries!!! They definitely got Red Robin beat on this one...thank goodness cuz I would've freaked out if my garlic fries order got fucked up again.

My tilapia burger portion was huge with lots of coleslaw in the middle. Had to tap out and left 1/5th of the burger behind cuz I was full from the giant mint-shake & the big side portion of garlic fries. Anyways this place may be small but they give out huge portions here so it's well worth the money :]
author: Rose C.

description:
Thought we would give this place a try since it's right around the corner from my bro's place.

I got the San Francisco Burger-- mushrooms, grilled onions, and blue cheese (all my favorite toppings!) but I was sadly disappointed. 

The burger itself was pretty average, and the toppings were fine. But what killed it was the soggy bread it came on. I could barely hold the thing together because the bread was so wet and flopping all over the place. I ended up taking one slice off and eating it like an open face sandwich. I hate to be such a downer... I mean, the fries were pretty decent! If you go with the San Francisco, I would recommend replacing with a bun instead of the sliced bread, or just getting it protein style with no bread.

Next time I'm at my bro's place and in the need for a quick meal, I'll stick with the burrito shop next door!
author: Kavita S.

description:
3.5 stars

This is a solid burger place. The selection is pretty big, with a lot of different kinds of combos to choose from, and they also have milkshakes with malt. The servers are very friendly as well, despite us coming in pretty late in the day.

The burger quality is not quite up there with some of the more well-known chains around SF. It's also next to some bars so if you happen to be out drinking with some friends, this is a perfectly fine place to stop by for a bite too.
author: Alice C.

description:
Delicious burgers cooked perfectly!  Don't be fooled if it's not as busy as the taco shop nextdoor; this place has awesome cheeseburgers...one of the best I've ever had.

I'll be sure to return to try their shakes. :)
author: Michael H.

description: I do a lot of business at the Safeway across the street and my team and I needed a quick place for lunch! The turkey burger I got was great and the owner was very friendly! I would recommend Burgermeister to anyone looking for a fast lunch option!
author: Hayley H.

description: WAY TOO EXPENSIVE and when it comes to asking for a lettuce wrap, they have NO clue what they're doing.  They give you one piece of flimsy lettuce on either side of your patty.  They might get out and check out other Burger places from time to time to see what the competition is up to.  The Habit and Red Robin both understand how to make a lettuce wrapped burger.  I've been here several times, and each time I tell myself that I won't go back because it's too expensive and just not worth it.  But I guess I keep forgetting.  Never again will I forget.  Won't be back.
author: Daniel S.

description: This place is fantastic! I'm an EMT and my partner and I just got off a call and stopped in here to give them a try on our way back. Best decision ever because our burgers were AHHHH-mazing. We had zero complaints. I had the ABC and he had the western burger. Juicy, full of flavor, and satisfying. In my opinion, better than any other burger out there. I also had the regular fries that come with (most places make you pay extra for your side, not here) and those were pretty good. My partner had garlic curly fries. We've never heard of a place with garlic curly fries. He loved them and to be honest, those were deish. I loved the roasted garlic on top. If you're a ranch fan and like to dip your fries, burger, etc. Their ranch is homemade and it's BOMB. Need I say more?!?!Yeah it's sort of a small place but it's clean, inviting and the staff are very nice and helpful! In fact, you'll probably be ordering from an EMT/Medic future firefighter. Thanks for an amazing experience!! We can't wait to come back!!!
author: Sarah J.

description: I just feel like the food in general was too greasy , and over priced and the onion rings were not super good. The staff was really friendly so that's why I'm giving 3.
author: Simon B.

description: The burger and sweet potato fries were decent, but together they cost $18, which seemed too high. I'd echo other reviews in saying I much prefer Super Duper for the prices, atmosphere, and probably the meat too.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I had such high expectations for this place, from the roasted garlic curly fries, to the double rainbow ice cream( my favorite) shakes. 

My boyfriend and I placed our order through the courier service Postmates. 
We both ordered the "build your own burger" burger with a myriad of toppings on each. I ordered mine as a lettuce wrap, without a bun. Yes our list of toppings was extensive, but it was offered, and we paid extra for it so why not?! 

I paced around my apartment waiting for the courier to arrive with our precious burgers. 

Neither of the burgers was the correct order by a long shot. I thought perhaps they accidentally gave us the wrong order?! But for literally 50 dollars for two create your own burgers ( you pay extra for each topping ) , and two orders of fries, and two vanilla MALT shakes.......I expected the world on my burger! 

Like I said neither of the burgers had any toppings we had ordered, one had a fried egg, swiss and a mound, no TWO mounds of mushrooms...GROSS!!!! The other did not come with the chili cheese fries ( extra 5 bucks ) just normal fries. C'MON WE'RE HONGRY BURGERMEISTER !!! The second burger was soaked in roasted red peppers, jalepenos, and more onions than I ever thought possible on a burger. DOUBLE EWW!!!! The MALTS had no malt to be found, and the ice cream definitely was not double rainbow. 

Huge disappointment, and for 2 people, 50 dollars?! REALLY?! We could have had umami burger twice! 

Please see pic attached of the unedible burgers. I hate to say it but, a quick trip to in-n-out would have been 100 times more satisfying, at a fraction of the cost.
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Voted the best burger in SF, I had to try it. Now obviously it can't be a bad burger if it's won so many awards so I'll just say it was okay. The beef was juicy and a good portion. I like how their suppliers are all local which is why the place is probably so good.

It's hard to be an astounding burger place - it's easier to be a really dumpy place or an a-okay place and this is one of those a-okay places. I personally am more of a Roam Burgers or Umami person.
author: Julia P.

description:
I don't like this place anymore.  The last two times I went here, I got poor customer service.  "Just to let you know," the cashier said, "we're closing in half an hour!  Just to let you know I'll be putting everything away!"  Not, "How are you?" or "What would you like?" or "Thanks for spending your money here so I can have a job."  

That's happened twice, but it won't happen a 3rd time.  I don't care if you're closing in half an hour, because I'm taking mine to go.  You'd know that if you asked.  I got food here for years, and the previous staff never seemed to feel the need to start announcing when they were closing in a way designed to drive you off.
author: Bruce S.

description: Love their gardenburger. And Candice is pretty phenomenal, and hilarious, and sweet... Despite me essentially breaking every goddamn thing in the place. Thanks Candice   -Mike...."Ugghh"
author: Mike M.

description:
Went with the steakhouse salad because I wanted something light and refreshing. Turned out to be a warm and greasy salad, not what i expected. Never had a greasy salad before, they basically threw a small, oily portion of a cheesesteak on top of some greens. Wouldnt recommend. 

Bro got fish n chips, was very mediocre but overpriced. 

Service was also subpar, a pissed off server who messed up our order and clearly hated his job.

All in all, wouldn't come here when so many better options exist
author: Joon B.

description: Really good burgers here! I got the ABC burger which has avocado, bacon and cheese and it was so good. definitely recommend this hidden gem.
author: Sheridan L.

description: Good burgers. Tarrell (probably spelled it wrong) was the man! It all starts with service and greetings, and he was good and witty and got me my food quick. Dope interaction. Burger is really good too. Did I say that? I'm still eating it.
author: Thomas A.

description: Quality service and even better food. Their sandwiches are amazing. High quality ingredients and very tasty fries. Great spot for lunch or dinner. Make this place a priority to go to and you'll be happy you did.
author: Will S.

description:
Burgermeister on Church has really gone downhill. Too bad.

I used to work fairly close to this Burgermeister and it was always great. But, after visiting recently, it is no longer the same and I will not be back. 

Beyond the fact that the menu had changed since we'd last visited, there were issues with the food, service and restaurant itself. After placing our order for four dinners, the food took a bit longer than expected, especially since the place was not very busy. 

The counter tops were greasy with old cups and napkins that we had to discard ourselves. The worst area was the ketchup/mustard/relish station which was sticky and had what looked like fruit flies hovering where you pump your condiments. 

Three of the dinners were standard hamburgers, which were fair, but a bit on the greasy side; this should not have been the case since the average price was about $12 each. The fourth dinner was a turkey burger that was supposed to come with a fried egg. 

What arrived was a dried-out piece of beige-colored leather with grill marks on it and no egg. We asked the employee about it and he said he would bring the egg and apologized, which was fine. But then, a different employee came up and said that he forgot to charge us for the egg and asked that my wife come up to the counter and pay for it(!). 

The employee admitted that it was his mistake but still insisted we leave our table and pay for it anyway, even though we had already waited about 20 minutes. It would be another 10 minutes before the substandard turkey burger could be consumed as originally ordered and it was a disappointment.

At this point, we wished we had gone to Super-Duper or one of the many good mom-and-pop places in the area. 

Sorry to see Burgermeister on Church St. go down hill and be so nickel-and-dimey about their services. Any business that is this penny-pinching over their own mistake is not a place that I want to be patronizing.
author: James A.

description:
I ordered the Build Your Own Burger with avocado, mushrooms and Swiss cheese.  It was the most delicious hamburger I have EVER eaten in my whole life.  The chocolate shake was outstanding as well.  

Five of us vacationing in San Fran - we all loved our food here.  Rave reviews from our group about the Philly Cheesesteak, chicken sandwich and various other cheeseburgers.  This restaurant was so wonderful, both food and service, that we returned for a second visit the next day.

Don't miss this place, it was incredible.  During both visits the employees were helpful and friendly.  Hands down the most friendly people we encountered during our vacation.
author: Mary M.

description:
SauceMeister.

Homemade veggie burger was great: http://www.yelp.com/biz/burgermeister-san-francisco-3?hrid=fb40P1YAKrpwmS-X2ksIvA

Homemade BBQ sauce on top of a grilled chicken breast and caramelized onions on a potato bun was excellent.

Also very messy. But not very expensive. Less than $8 with tax before the friendly and speedy staff's much deserved tip.

Five stars for this boss of the sauce.
author: Jason B.

description:
Funny - 6 years later - went back yesterday - didn't realize whether I'd ever been - and felt ***EXACTLY*** the same. The BBQ sauce is OFF. Seriously, Bullseye would be a giant step up.

Edit - root beer makes sense. Couldn't pin point why I hated that sauce and now I know why: I hate root beer. Mystery solved.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I've worked across the street from Burgermeister for the past four years, and since then I have gained another four pounds every year from eating there. I'm not trying to discourage you, the problem is the food so damn good that's hard to stay away. This particular Burgermeister is at a convenient location, across the street from the ghetto Safeway, and can hold close to fifteen people.
They have wide variety of burgers, and specialty sandwiches, my personal favorite is the Philly Cheesesteak with curly fries. Everything is made fresh and on the spot. They also have a selection of premium beer on tap, or taste milkshakes for the kid in you.
I give this restaurant only four stars for two reasons, one: a bit steep in price, an average meal is $12. Two: seating. It's a small restaurant and sometimes can not accommodate, unless you want eat outside and either be shaking from the SF wind or harassed by the local homeless. Besides those two factors it's a great place to eat. Remember, everything in moderation.
author: Joel G.

description: My boyfriend and I both got the (vegan) veggiemeister patties with grilled pineapple, sautéed onions and mushrooms which was excellent. We also got garlic fries and curly fries. Everything was tasty and the portions were really great but I'm docking 2 stars because they overcharged me by $5 and one of the waiters (I think) wasn't very friendly. The food is good but make sure to double check your bill before you pay.
author: Kim H.

description:
Ok, maybe I'm just being completely mesmerized by the millions of bars by here that all of a sudden makes me have a craving for a burger.
But honestly, this particular Burgermeister seems to make their burgers with a special something something.

Nicely grilled and beautifully connected with its cheese and burger veggies. Fries are nice and crispy. Get them with garlic for an extra splash of awesome!
author: Winè C.

description:
I have been a long-time customer of Burgermeister starting at the Cole Valley location and now attending the Church street location the last 2 years.  Their meats ares great quality and their service is speedy.  If you want 1 of the top 10 burgers in the City go here.  

My fav is the California Burger with a side salad.
author: Jaiden F.

description: We got lost and just happened upon this little place.   It's not fancy by any means but the help was very friendly and the food was absolutely delicious.   Two of us has burgers that they said were the best ever.  I had a chicken/bacon/avocado sandwich on French toast and loved every bite of it.
author: M A.

description: My burger was nearly $16 ($2 for sweet potato fries). The burger is very tasty, and I am sure the price is justified, but holy wow! Honestly, I really only go here for the swwt potato fries dipping sauce. Best sauce on the planet.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Yummy in my tummy.  This little joint is a great spot to grab a quick eat.  i wouldn't recommend a long excursion.  Get in, order and get out.  take your burger to go and walk to Duboce park for a nice summer lunch in the sun.  

Located conveniently next to Safeway on Church street, you'll find this small Burgermeister.  The staff is fairly friendly and the prices are pretty typical for SF.

Grab a bite and enjoy.
author: Kevin J.

description: Amazingly long wait and no concern for customer. I love burgermeister  and have been to many locations, but this one sucks
author: Jos C.

description: It was pretty decent. A bit pricey. Asked how I wanted my burger cooked and I said well came out with center pink. Not a fan of pink in my hamburgers. Still it had good flavor.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Like the north beach location, I go here for the delicious veggie meister burger, seasoned curly fries, and beer. Service has always been quick and friendly here, and the price is reasonable.

Only downside (and this goes for the north beach location too) is that they stock pepsi products in the soda fountain rather coca-cola. But the fact that I do still really like this place despite such a faux-paus says something.
author: Jon T.

description: The burger was good, but this review is mainly for the garlic fries - garlic fries that'll leave you garlic-y for days!
author: Jenn C.

description:
THIS PLACE WAS THE BOMBBBBBBB.

The burgers are so juicy and tasty, buns toasted to perfections, onions and tomatoes were fresh and the cheese melted just right. 
 
My sister said this was the place to go, so we came here as a goodbye dinner before I flew back to Boston.

Great choice!
author: Stephanie D.

description: I love this place. My favorite burger is the  western, the staff is always friendly and yes there pricey but it's totally worth it this place is under rated.
author: Josh R.

description: Is not what used to be, floor, table are dirty, it doesn't smell clean. food Taste is ok, the bum of the burger was to wet, impossible to eating:(  the quality have been decline. Hope they can fix thise issues bcs is a good place to stop.
author: Margarita L L.

description: Ugh. In a sentence, I'll tell you this place has gone downhill because they changed their meat. Definitely a much lower quality of hamburger. What a bummer. This place used to be a decent place to grab a burger and fries. Nothing fancy, but decent. They used to have two burger sizes on the menu. Now it's one: the smaller size, and the meat is clearly cheaper than what they used to offer. The fries are still good. But it's off the list now for a quick bite. Maybe I'll try Super Duper again.
author: Denis B.

description:
This review is strictly for management: most of the employees I interacted with were lovely. 
I had a serious craving for garlic fries. I went in and tried for a while to figure out what to pair that with. After deciding for quite a while, I opted for a "make your own burger" option. 
As I started to order, it took the cashier a while to figure out everything. No problem, I've worked in bars/restaurants for almost 20 years so I'm sensitive to newer employees or cashiers that just want to go slower to make sure they got it right.
After going through my order multiple times (on their end), I pay, tip, and take a seat. When it takes almost 15 minutes to pour my draft beer, I was concerned but noticed that they were having trouble pouring the beer and patiently waited. (Seriously, train your staff on how to pour beers and you could save yourself a lot of money in beer waste and labor).
Again, no problem. I don't mind waiting when I have the time. After a long time, my food is finally ready. After telling them 3 times that I was dining in, my food was packaged to go. 
The server proudly declared that I got the last order of (garlic) fries for the night since the fryer had stopped working.  My main issue was that the fryer wasn't working when they made mine either. They were lukewarm, soggy, and gross. I immediately went back up to the register and explained that I couldn't eat them since they were raw. He kindly apologized and asked if I would prefer salad or coleslaw. I ended up a minute later with a bowl of lettuce with my salad dressing on the side. A bowl of lettuce is not a salad!!! Especially, when the customer paid for an upgraded side.
After eating my overcooked burger, I waited in line to try to recoup some of my money from being overcharged, but I lost interest after a while. 
I don't really care about getting a dollar back, but I do care about telling management that they need to step up their employee training. Things happen, I get it. I think you have some great people working for you, but you need to work on training them. When things go wrong, you need to make sure that they understand how to handle things. The $1 overage should have been immediately been refunded to me or my salad should have been offered to be upgraded. 
Nothing that happened tonight is enough to make me never go there again, but in a city as competitive as SF, it will be a long time till I'm willing to risk spending my hard earned money on a meal where I might not feel value to it.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Still one of the best burgers in town. 23$ and some change is a bit rich for my taste for a burger onion rings and a shake. But I killed it and it was delish.. I'll be back for my next heart attack.. :)
author: nancy w.

description: So I eat a lot of burgers in San Francisco, seldom at chain's. But the Burger I had today was AMAZING!! Fresh well cooked and oh sooo yummy. Combined with the best customer service I have had since I can remember. Kudos to the management at Burgermeister for finding and keeping this terrific crew. I'm gonna call Monday morning to talk personally to someone to make sure they get a pat on the back. My new favorite place to get a burger and a smile.
author: Roman S.

description:
Sometimes you're really, really hungry and just craving a big, juicy burger.

In such situations, Burgermeister will do the trick! :-)
author: Denise B.

description: The food is good! Minus one star because the girl taking our order didn't listen well. Focus on one thing at a time and that one thing should be the customer right in front of you.
author: Nikki R.

description:
I seriously love Burgermeister. Veggie patties are awesome, tonnes of toppings to choose from (mushrooms and smoked cheddar yo) and the garlic fries were just phenomenal. It really tastes like roasted garlic on them, and I don't know how but the fries are never soggy even with that garlic on top. Most places I get burgers at, I add condiments, and fries always have ketchup, but I never bother here. The taste is just that awesome.

Great, now I'm hungry again, just thinking about it.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I ordered the Meister Burger w/ a side of onion rings and a clam chowder.. hands down it was one of the juciest burgers I've ever wolfed down!  The clam chowder was very good as well.. of course I've consumed my daily calories in one sitting but it was so worth it!

The friendly staff made it all worth while too.. I will try the Wester Burger next.
author: Tram N.

description: Great food and the staff is lovely. Worth the cost and I will be back!
author: Jules I.

description:
I love Burgermeister! This location is particularly good in that it is central and easy to get to, but also because it's never really packed or empty.  Service tends to be quick, and they offer a happy hour for some of their beers.

If you're looking for a classic burger with solid ingredients or to try something different, this is your place. They have a lot of fun options in terms of burgers and toppings and everything is customizable.  The burgers come in two sizes, but even the small is pretty filling.  My personal fave is the Western, which comes with BBQ sauce, cheddar, bacon and onion rings. Burgers come with a side of fries, beans or salad. I love having options.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
It would be unlike me to mozy into a burger joint, even if it's pathetically close to my house. I need a little push. Little push turns to shove. 

Somehow a little devil of a friend of mine seems to lure me into eating things I'd never order myself http://www.yelp.com/biz/ikes-place-san-francisco#hrid:KSb__MAzFUZE8SDvLi5SUQ.

It's one of those love-hate so-bad-it's-good kind of relationships.

In walks chili cheese fries and two forks.

While I'm thoroughly enjoying a juicy turkey burger w/'shrooms, onions & bleu, I couldn't resist. Game on.

The burger would've been enough. Really. They're fairly hefty. Keep adding fries and you will be too. Somehow getting to the bottom of the basket wasn't that difficult either. Slightly concerning, but worth it.

The tab adds up quick here and it cost a bit more than I'd anticipate for a laminated-table, quick serve type of joint. I have no complaints about the food - only my peer-pressuring accomplices.
author: Alissa A.

description: Very good service, very clean, great burgers, french fries are also very crispy! Definitely recommend checking this place out. Only gripe = slightly pricy, but worth it
author: Nicco M.

description:
The cooks get in such a hurry that they overcook the burgers. I'm not a grill cook myself but I'm thinking that they have the flame up too high. 

Note to the cooks: People would rather wait a little while longer and have their food taste good, instead of getting it fast but dried out. 

Also, the last time I went, there was a hair in my onion rings. BUT this actually isn't that big of a deal to me. Yes, it's gross, but it happens. The overcooking thing, though, they really need to work on.
author: johan b.

description: 3 days after writing my terse/disappointed review, an owner of Burgermeister's contacted me to follow up on my experience.  She apologized without excuse and wanted a few more details.  When she mentioned they strive for excellence in customer service, I definitely got that feeling based on her response to me.  And additionally, if you go to any other Burgermeister (Daly City, Cole, North Beach), the service is Usually friendly.  Based on her response to me, I will definitely give them another try (I was going to any way--just not the Church St one--but now I might pop in to report back to her).  It was a pleasant surprise to at least get a personal message from someone at Burgermeister--responding to my experience.  I hope they can give the feedback to that employee to be a little more customer focused rather than immersed in dour.  And I wish them all the success.
author: Philip L.

description:
[edited in response to owner comments] 

Pretty good burger, but I've had better (and just as organic) for half the price or lots cheaper to be mathematically accurate.

My friend and I ordered the 1/2 pound burgermeister to split with fries and a drink - no joke, it was almost $18. other places that also serve 1/2 lb niman ranch cheeseburgers for $6-8 include places like zeitgeist, super duper, burger house, tower burger, and hall of fame burger - they also don't charge split fees and many of them include fries.

I ended up going back and upgrading to garlic fries, and they pileeeeeeeeee on the garlic. I went to a sports bar afterwards and felt so bad for my friends when I had to talk loudly near their faces because of all the cheering for the detroit lions that was going on. heh. 

Service was good, friendly. The place was clean.


Not saying this is a bad burger at all, I just also include value (product and price) to the ratings compared with other apples. I believe it matters and is part of the whole consumer experience.
author: Wendy M.

description:
I walked in last night to a completely empty restaurant. It was 6:30 so I thought I would've caught them at their busiest time. Not a single customer but I thought I'd give them a try. 

I walked up to the register and nobody was there. I waited a while and thought maybe they went and grabbed something or are stocking-- I didn't mind waiting. Then as I stood there for close to a minute, a cook asked me if I had ordered already. I told him no and then he rang a bell several times. 

This young guy comes out from the back, apron untied and reeking of marijuana. He was clearly high and laughing to himself. I was annoyed at his behavior but ordered my food anyway. After I paid he asked me if I wanted a free beer. I said no and he said "I like giving away beer it makes people happy." He was so far gone. 

Most of the tables were dirty so i couldn't sit in an area I would've liked. The food was mediocre but was probably ruined by my customer service experience. I will not be back.
author: Leslie P.

description:
Prices for a burger range from about $8 to $12.  But it's worth it, because they're pretty good.  If you're looking for something super cheap, this is probably not your cup of tea.

Now I hate when burger joints slather nasty ass condiments all over my food, and this place is one of those burger joints where you add whatever you want.  Phew.  They had the typical condiments, jalapenos, hot sauces, etc which you can add at your own leisure.  I LOVE that.  

Fries were good, cheesesteak looked good.  I just got a plain ole cheeseburger and it totally hit the spot.

Random story - it seems one employees job is simply to hand out the key to the bathroom.  And let me tell ya', she did a great job.  Random, I know.  But I had to mention it.
author: Terran O.

description: For someone who doesn't eat beef, this place really has no options besides vegan and or fish.  The fish burger, I must stress, tasted like eating straight up SALT.  That's right.  I have never eaten anything that salty in my entire life before.  After tossing out the fish, even the bun was ultra-salty.  I did not need to get salt for the fries because I could get my fries season just by touching the fish itself.  Definitely not recommended for someone with heart-conditions that requires a low-sodium diet.  Interior was dim and stuffy/greasy feel.
author: Chi T.

description: Hey guys, please wash your hands after smashing flies on the wall. I guess I got extra protein with your terrible service.
author: Brendan m.

description: Awesome burgers, as fresh as it gets, love their mushroom Swiss and their fries too. What blew me away was their milk shakes it was out of this world. Will be coming again soon.
author: Syed A.

description: First time in a while that the service was so far below their food. From not understanding my order to being rude for me inadvertently doing something you don't like, this group of people working there now is subpar.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Best burgers in SF!

I always build my own burger and the wait staff are incredibly friendly/helpful. Their sautéed onions and bleu cheese are so good.

Get the onion rings or garlic fries on the side! Yum yum.
author: Anthony Y.

description: The food here is great! The portions are huge though so if you are not super hungry you can definitely split. They offer all the normal burger toppings and more! The sweet potato fries are fabulous too. Both times I've been there has been virtually no wait wait time. Staff is friendly and service was nice.
author: Amanda C.

description: Tasty, cooked-to-order burgers and delicious curly fries. What's not to like?
author: David K.

description: I thought the service was really friendly and exceptional. The burger was really good too. I like how you can order a different size patty. Everything was fresh.
author: Amy H.

description: Food was about average. Worst part was the incredibly rude, snappy girl taking my pickup order.
author: Shane S.

description:
Burgermeister has been serving Niman Ranch patties for over a decade now. They take their job seriously and it shows with their growth in locations. I applaud them for their detailed nutrition listings, for all types of patty and condiment combinations. 

Here you'll get a good burger at a fair price. In my case, it was $10.42 with tax for a 1/3lb bacon cheeseburger, which comes with fries. The patty was cooked medium as requested, though nearly medium rare, with a clear distinction between the brown and pink parts of the patty. 

The wide variety of sauces for my burger and/or fries was a nice touch. The red pepper aioli and the peppercorn steak sauce were solid and clearly carried their own distinct flavorings.

Overall, this burger exceeded expectations, and helped me understand why several local Burgermeister franchises are operating today. The management has put a lot of thought into creating a good burger experience, for both food and service.
author: Mike H.

description:
I'm a big fan of a burger joints where you know where exactly your beef is coming from and always makes me happy to see a place proud to express their burgers are 100% Niman Ranch beef. I'm from Los Angeles and I was visiting this great city for a week when a local friend of mine showed us this compact, full-flavored burger spot.

The first thing I saw on the menu was the Pastrami Burger, and my mouth immediately began to salivate haha. I'm a HUGE fan of pastrami and I was happy to see that theirs are Niman Ranch beef also so WHY NOT right?? Their patties come in two sizes, third-pounders and half-pounders, and i was thinking I should probably get the third pounder patty because another 1/3 pound of pastrami would be layered on top of that juicy patty. The last few burger places I've went to asked "would you like pink on your burger or no pink?" and i would reply, "medium-rare" but they looked puzzled o.O? and that made me NOT wanna go there anymore because they would most likely be using a pre-set charbroiling oven. I'm a chef that enjoys the expertise of a fellow cook using his skills to KNOW when a burger is cooked so I was happy to see that my "medium-rare" specified burger was cooked EXACTLY that way. 


Honestly, the burger was so huge, I had to cut it into pieces to not look like a complete carnivorous animal in front of my friend and girlfriend. The burger was juicy, the pastrami was AMAZING, but my only comment would be to not add so much of  the caramelized onion and maybe 86 it all together because the sweetness of the onions overpowered the well-seasoned taste of the burger and pastrami. Overall, I was very satisfied, and next time I go, I will surely grab a pint of the four or five beers they have on tap. One of the best burgers I've ever had. Trust me!
author: Jared A.

description:
SPENDY!  A CheeseBurger + Veggie Burger + 1 beer + Rootbeer Float = $35??? What?  No table service. Kind of crazy ... Food tasted OK, but couldn't fully enjoy my Veggie Burger with the burning, lingering taste of highway robbery in my mouth and upon my wallet!  

For better service, food and value: Chow - two blocks away.
author: J M.

description:
The burgers are huge and look good, but are too greasy to me. The fries are good. And what I really like about this place are the milkshakes! We got a caramel milkshake, so good, yum! It's a good place.

Also, do NOT get the buffalo chicken sandwich. It's similar to pulled pork, in that it's shredded chicken drenched in hot sauce. Torture for little pleasure.
author: Heather R.

description:
Burgermeister is a good burger, it is...but 2 things:

1. Most importantly, lower the prices dude....you get a soda or a beer and somehow it ends up being like a $15-$20 burger

2. Offer some more burger meat options...for example you have kobe beef philly cheesesteak, why not a kobe ground burger? or perhaps some exotic meats like bison or ostrich, ive had them in burgers and they are tasty and not too gamey. Anything really..but they only have regular ground chuck burgers, yea its from niman ranch, but these days thats not too special all its own. itd be nice to make a diff burger thats not jus diff toppings by now.
author: Belito L.

description: I had a build-your-own burger and went with the 1/3 Niman Ranch burger patty, sauteed jalapenos, bacon and avocado on a whole wheat bun. As a side I went with the half fries, half salad option. I have to say that the whole meal was delicious. The burger was cooked perfectly (I ordered medium) and the toppings were high quality and very tasty. The fries were fresh, hot and had just the right amount of crisp. This was my first Burgermeister experience and I would definitely return again.
author: Kristin H.

description: Fantastic burgers. Had the teriyaki burger and it was the best. Great thing is, you can have your burger cooked the way you want it. Rare to well. Prices are decent for San Francisco. The place isn't the prettiest or the fanciest, but it's clean. You get a choice of two sizes of burgers, 1/3 lb and 1/2 lb. the drink of choice is Pepsi products and there is also draft beer and milkshakes. Located right across from Safeway Grocery store.
author: Mark C.

description:
The only bad thing I can say about this place is that it is a tad expensive for a fast food burger place.  I paid ~$9 for a 1/3 lb. burger, fries, and cup of water.

The restaurant was clean and had plenty of seating.  The food came out quickly, and the fries were fresh and crispy - best I had had in a long time.

It was friendly/cool/strange that the guy working the counter remembered my name and said good-bye to me on the way out.

I'll probably be back here the next time I have visitors in town and ask for a good burger joint.
author: Tran C.

description:
Burgermeister just didn't do it for me. I wanted to like them for a pretty decent meal deal in which you get a burger, fries and a soda for $7 but it was underwhelming. 

It wasn't bad by any means but I could have got a better burger at In-n-out for $4 or for $10 an amazing burger at a couple of places near my house (Street, Bar Johnny etc. 

I would say it's average. Location is convenient off a MUNI exit.
author: Carlos A.

description:
If you want a juicy, delicious Niman Ranch beef hamburger, go to Burgermeister.

The burger, fries and shakes are all very tasty, freshly cooked to order (I like mine medium rare and they do it right every time!)

Fries are crispy big cut fries with very hot great potato taste.
And if you want to get really decadent, get the ice cream shake. I always get chocolate, but my friends have gotten other flavors and they all have been very happy with the taste and consistency.

The service is mostly great, friendly and cheerful. Every once in a while there is a certain employee who acts like he wishes he wasn't there but he is the only one.

The toppings you can have are highly varied and can make for an big meal when paired with burger.

The cole slaw is usually pretty good and crunchy too!
author: Armando H.

description:
Had to go to this place after seeing how many rave reviews it was getting.

Highlights:
-Large burger, patty cooked perfectly
-Tons of variety!
-Lots of cheese!
-Fries are crispy and golden
-Staff is extremely friendly
-Casual atmosphere

Group next to me got the Chili Cheese Fries.  It looked SO good!  Will try them next time.
author: Larissa A.

description: Food was great, good menu and large portions. A little pricer than expected judging from the look and ambiance of the place, but the staff seemed nice and I enjoyed my meal.
author: Luis O.

description:
So now we have chain boutique burger shacks in San Francisco. Burger Joint, Sliders and the ever expanding Burgermeister. Burgermeister makes a fine burger. Their locations are clean and the staff is always friendly. The French Fries are average at best. They have a few beers on tap, thats good, and they have Pepsi in the fountain, thats bad as I am a Coke man. 

   Now here is the big question. Should we really pay $15-$17 for a burger fries and beverage? Why is it that the myriad of pubs and select restaurants can offer the same affair for $9-$12? I am left to wonder why in the world should I pay 50% more at one of these boutique burger shacks? I welcome all PM's that can offer me a realistic argument as to what I am getting that is so much better at these burger boutiques. Needless to say, I won't be a regular customer.
author: Christopher N.

description:
This place has it going ON!

Great service(Is someone new there?), quick & efficient most everyday. Clean. The burgers are amazing. Presentation was on top. Not shy with the fry action. The assortment of sauces available, although not always full, is a winner for me. I put the green Tabasco on EVERYTHING. My favorite burger here is, naturally, the San DIego. And of course, since I'm a picky bitch, I add the avocado. Superb! People can rip on price point, but its still a burger. You want good & cheap, go get Mc Dangles.

Can we get more beer selection? Variety in non-alcoholic bevies might be nice here. Love Taylor's Tonics...

Music choice is not my flavor,... I wanted to play my skullyboom the whole time there.
author: Kai N.

description:
Absolute disappointment I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, I regret comming here, it's not the most friendly place to go to, when I go in to any establishment for the first time it should have a pleasant fill of being welcome, acceptable, and polite, the person taking the oder was impolite and rude, he said his name was Ed when i ask for is name, I lost my appetite because of his horrible service, plus the burger was dry considering the price was OUCH! (ridiculous), I was not pleased about that, I should had walk away.

So, I took time out and read some of the comments on the wall about the food here, some from a well known SF news paper and others, that said this place was the best, WHUT the WHUT? Did someone tell the owner the writer was coming in on that day are what? This place is overrated.

Keep It Real This Place Sucks....
author: Marvin H.

description: Burgermeister is a solid place to grab a burger and I definitely recommend checking it out! The California burger in particular is fantastic! Avocado and pepper jack? Yes, please! Also, the sweet potato fries are great! If you are in the mood for a burger, definitely check out Burgermeister.
author: Sophia A.

description: First customers on a Saturday morning, first-timers too. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. And the food is to DIE for! I eat burgers a lot, and BurgerMeister's are easily some of the best I've ever had. The curly fries and cheesesteaks are delightful too. Awesome establishment; will bring friends here anytime I'm in the area.
author: Chris S.

description:
First time there, will definitely be back. Been looking at it in passing for a year now thinking " I really have to check that out one day" and sure enough I'm kicking myself for not going sooner. 
I had the "San Francisco" ( 1/3lb. grilled onions & mushrooms and blue cheese) Wished later I got the 1/2 pounder. Onion Rings were a little extra more upgrading from the fries but well worth it. Cooked perfectly in a crispy batter. Onion doesn't drag out when you bite into it, "I hate that" !
My partner got the Classic Cheese Burger, comes with lettuce, tomato, pickle on the side. Then added bacon to it. Thick slices of the apple-wood smoked variety. Initially, they forgot to add the bacon but quickly rectified the matter. Check it out and tell me when your going. Ill join ya. ;)
author: John W.

description:
Sub-par burgers in an area with SO many excellent options. I've been here twice now, and have been disappointed both times. 

Despite the other complaints about service, I didn't really have a problem here. The people were all fine- didn't go out of their way to be helpful, but not rude or anything. The one turn-off was when one of the employees was on her break eating a salad at the bar right next to the cash register. She was chatting away loudly with all the other employees, and it just seemed unprofessional and distracting. All the restaurants I've worked in have required employees to eat in a separate area. 

As for the food, eh. Both burgers were overdone and not juicy at all. Something about this place just doesn't jive. If you are billing yourself as a "fine dining establishment" then act like it! Use servers like Barneys, and up the level of professionalism among the staff. 

Super Duper beats Burgermeister. Hands down.
author: L B.

description: A solid beefy burger and chocolate malt for sure. Their new 'veggie burger' however is nothing short of gross...they should go back to the MorningStar stuff.
author: David S.

description:
Great place to have a burger. I had a regular cheeseburger with pepper jack cheese and sweet potato fries. Delicious, though I wish the upgrade to sweet potato wasn't 2.75.

All in all a delicious place to eat, just a bit pricey. Expect $10+ burgers.
author: Finn F.

description:
Totally 4 stars because the manager Isaac IS a star - as you can see from the comments, he was very detailed and considerate in his response. And clearly I had to enjoy it b/c as soon as the cards came in the mail today, me and my BF were back like bees on honey. 

The cards were for free burgers (my BF got the Meister burger and being a discriminate burger eater was sufficiently enthralled to give a few signature cross-eyed expressions of approval) and they were totally cool with using mine for the mouth-watering Kobe steak salad I wrote about in my original review.

So absolutely worth bumping to 4 stars as (1) the food is just as good as we remembered; and (2) the service ROCKS.

I'm definitely converted into fanhood: thanks again Isaac!
author: Diane B.

description:
This is actually a review for the NorthBeach location, but I eat at this one as well and have had the same experience.

Plain and simple just a great little burger joint. I have never and I mean that sincerly, never had a bad burger here. The fries are almost perfect, I like mine nice and crispy. The fixins are fresh. The service has always been with a smile.
Just a quick note, a few years ago when the City and County put in place "Healthly SF"  mandatory health care coverage. Burgermeister was adding a surcharge of $1.75 to their orders. Truth be told it really pissed me off. $1.75 per order x how many orders a day? It would have seemed they were actually making a profit just on surcharges. I made mention to them. It must have resonated because they no longer have the surcharge.

Anyway it is a great place for a quick bite.
author: david b.

description:
Everything here was great. The service, the food, and the interior. A bit pricey, but not overkill. If you're in the area and want a burger, this is certainly the place to get one!

I was actually taking the N to see Haight and the park, got off right there starving! Glad to have found the place.
author: Eddy B.

description:
This place is so good. Seriously.

Burger places don't usually do it for me, they're just so generic...but WOW. Burgermeister is pretty darn good. They have a "San Francisco Burger" featuring grilled onions, bleu cheese and mushrooms. It was the best thing that I've eaten in... well maybe in a week. 

I ordered onion rings with my burger. I like that they have BBQ sauce that you can take to go. I love BBQ sauce and I feel like it is either non-existent or some guarded commodity at a lot of places. Thanks Burgermeister for giving me all the BBQ sauce that I want and/or need.

They also serve sweet potato fries. I didn't notice them on the menu when I ordered, but the guy behind me ordered them. I saw them come up at the counter... and... they were crinkle-cut! Oh my. Crinkle. Cut. Sweet potato. Fries. I can't wait to go back and order them... and yes, I will be taking an excessive amount of BBQ sauce home with me also.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
I give this place 4 1/2 stars. The burger was truly amazing...meat cooked to perfection, fresh lettuce, tomatos, onions and pickles, nice crispy edged warm bun, and delicious fries. I got a 1/3 lb cheeseburger, side fries and a drink for $12-which is a pretty typical amount for lunch these days in SF. The food was great and very quick service. The only thing preventing this place from having 5 stars is that the cashier could have been more friendly and welcoming (I kind of felt like I was bugging her) and the ambiance of the place could be a little less dull. But other than that I would highly recommend coming here if you're craving a burger. The one in Cole Valley is great as well, they actually have a better ambiance and the cashier was super friendly there. So all in all Burgermeister is an awesome restaurant no matter which location you go to.

Highly recommended!
author: Jena W.

description: Had the Classic Meister with a strawberry milkshake. It was amazing! Will definitely be back for more. Friendly service and delicious food.
author: Francisco M.

description: Hands down, best burger in SF. Try the Mushroom Swiss. The flavor of the beef ist just awesome and cooked to perfection. I really like their second branch in cole valley as well!
author: Daniel R.

description: Soggy fries, mediocre veggie burger. Nice service though!
author: Natalie C.

description: After walking a long distance wondering where all the restaurants were, we stumbled on this place.  Burgers were big and juicy w/ lots of options.
author: Richard F.

description:
My experience at Burgermeister was an absolute disappointment.  I was told by a friend that they had the best burger in town.  I was going to stay with a friend in the Lower Haight and so I thought I would try it out.  Ironic that I went to the Church location instead of the Berkeley one.

So I was expecting a juicy burger, but my medium burger was very dry.  I saw some semblance of pink in the middle, but for a half pound burger there was absolute no juice.  The avocado one top of my California style were the best part and there was a good amount of it.  The fries were tasty, but no better than any of the other burger places nearby.  If I paid 7 bucks for this mediocre burger and fries, then I wouldn't be so sad.  I paid 12 something.  Absolutely overrated.  Not worth it.  Go to Home instead.  Or Burger King.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I Love This Place! I come here every-time I come up to San Francisco. If I am craving a burger or my friends are this is this the place to go!

Yeah people say it's "too Expensive"  but I say, "You Get What You Pay For!"

You want cheap go to the MC Donald's; you want the good stuff you have to pay a little more.

Oh! And the Malts and Banana Splits are Awesome as Well!
author: Petrina j.

description: So I've finally been compelled to write a Yelp review. All I have to say is don't expect me to eat at your restaurant if you YELL at your customers. My friends and I went here this past Saturday because we were in San Francisco for the weekend and we were craving burgers. When we walked in, we decided to put our stuff down at a table. However, we were stopped short and were told that there were a lot of customers in line and that they needed to sit down first... in a very loud and rude tone. I'M SORRY!? Jeez. After being yelled at, we proceeded to walk out the door and eat tacos next door instead. Horrible customer service.
author: Jake P.

description:
I got the San Francisco burger which was blue cheese, mushrooms and grilled onions. The burger was cooked exactly to order and the fries were fresh and crispy. It was also a plus to have SF Prohibition Ale on tap. 

The only reason I didn't give the 'Meister a 5 was because it did nothing special for me. I'll only give 5's to a burger place if they really go out on a limb to be original.  

All aside, It was a great burger joint and I would definitely return.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Not vegan. Not even vegetarian. 

Here's how my conversation went when I discovered this:
Me: Hey, I'd like a vegan burger. Do you toast the buns with butter?
Cashier: Yes, they're toasted with butter.
Me: Ok. And do you toast on that griddle? *Looking over at the griddle with buttered buns and bacon cooking on it*
Cashier: Yes.
Me: Ok, i definitely don't want mine toasted then.
Cashier: *Confused look* Ok.
(I pay and sit at the bar across from the grill. I watch them flip burgers all on this huge grill with the same greasy, darkened spatula. So I go back to the cashier.)
Me: Hey, do you grill the vegan burger on that same grill as the other burgers?
Cashier: Yeah.
Me: Ok, that's not vegan. Can I cancel that?
Cashier: *Looking incredibly confused.* Sure.

Needless to say, a meat-stained vegan burger, is not vegan. Nor is it vegetarian. However, the cashier was incredibly nice although she didn't understand why I had to cancel. She was very sweet, canceled the burger and refunded my money. I tipped her well for the trouble.

The fries are delish. Two stars for the nice service and variety of fry options.
author: Jennie L.

description:
Quality beef burgers and alternatives. They also started offering breakfast foods which I haven't tried yet. I do have to say that their chili burger with the chili on the side with curly fries is to die for. A bit pricey and they only take cash, but actually worth it. They are quickly made and extremely tasty! I personally like this place better than The Counter in Palo Alto. 

They also have VERY tasty milkshakes. Nothing too creative, only the normal flavors (chocolate, strawberry and vanilla). It's thick creamy.... with the consistency of slightly melted ice cream.
author: Eric C.

description: I recently moved to the city, and hadn't really found a burger that moved me. Then I met this place. I would recommend the Jalapeno burger- so good! Their fries are always fresh too. They have curly fries that I can't say no to. It is a bit on the pricey side, but if you're craving a burger this will do the trick.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Very solid neighborhood choice for your burger cravings. Not something I'd cross the city for, but perfectly satisfying.

Food: Solid
Portions: Huge
Service Friendly
Prices: OK
author: Janett R.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of Burgermeister on Church Street. For starters, they know how to cook a burger the way I love it (Medium rare...but more rare than medium--that's what I'm talking about). The food is consistently good. Can't say I've ever had a bad experience here. 

What I really love about this place is that they serve beef from the Niman Ranch (sustainable, humane, environmentally responsible.) They also have made an effort to be very ecologically sound in the way they operate the business by recycling and composting trash.

The service is always good... I find the staff to be very friendly. The burgers are a bit pricier than average, but you get your choice of a side with the sandwich. Burgermeister is definitely my "go to" for a nice burger and fries... 

OH... and they actually do milk shakes and malts the way they should be done. YUM!!
author: Jerome I.

description:
Please note: I will be coming back again and the fourth star is for the service.

I think I was in an off-mood when I went last night. I hadn't eaten since noon and it was around 9pm, having just finished my work load at Starbuck's for the night in the Safeway lot and hungry Choco-ken waiting at home for me to feed and liberate his bladder.

The cashier, an awesome geek who kept me entertained and made sure I had everything perfectly as I wanted. He even figured out that my name spells "atila" backwards, in less than a minute. The second fastest person to figure that out, after my guy's mom! :) Ah smart people and History Channel buffs - they always bring a smile to my face.

My burger was super rare, as I wanted, but I think the grilled onions ruined it for me. The combination just didn't work, so next time, no grilled onions for me! Plus I haven't been able to eat as much lately, so it's probably all mental. I'm coming back just for the awesome cashier alone!
author: Alita M.

description:
Popped in here the other day because I was starving.  Big mistake.
