This place is expensive.  Very expensive especially given the quality of the food.  My hotdog was delivered cold and my fries were limp and soggy.  My dog, fries and drink came to a ridiculous $12.  Who are they trying to kid?

The place was not very clean and the staff were indifferent.  Not rude, but it was clear they didn't care at all which was evidenced by the 20+ minutes it took to deliver a cold hotdog with fries that had clearly been sitting around for quite some time.  

Definitely not a place I would recommend.
author: Russell D.

description: When you go to McDonalds you expect McDonalds, but I expect something a little better than that when I went to Burgermeister. Ordered a turkey burger, guy asks how I want that cooked...dude its turkey, I want it cooked like turkey is supposed to be cooked, like done. Ordered cheese on it, get back to the office...no cheese, but I paid for it,  must be coming in the mail. Fries were so so, probably should have gotten sweet potato fries. So really, Id save my money and my time and just go to Barneys.
author: Devin P.

description: Super fast service and well made food!!! The fried pickles are a little spicy but everything is Great!!!!
author: Dunia W.

description:
Despite the slightly high prices for burgers, I really like this spot.  The burgers are well-seasoned and well-cooked, which is hard to find when it comes to burger spots.  Each bite is very savory and you realize that you get what you pay for.  The fries and onion rings are good and, to top it all off, they have Mitchell's ice cream shakes...the best one is vanilla.

The service at this location is usually pretty good and it's clean, which makes for a good dinning experience.
author: Ken G.

description:
Being a sucker for burgers makes it really hard when your friend lives RIGHT next door to it, and says "It's been voted the best burger in SF." Ok so finally nearly 2 years after moving to SF I finally get to stop on in. Verdict? 

1. I wouldn't say it's the best burger in SF, but it's average.
2. $16 for a Western Burger, fries, & a Coke seems a bit over priced for what it is.
3. Service was friendly and quick.
4. 20 Napkins later-my fingers still smell like beef, bacon, & BBQ sauce!
5. Clean eating area, with many condiments available (even a choice between regular mustard & gray poupon).
6. They even have sandwiches (fish & chicken), hot dogs, sweet potato fries, fish & chips, etc.
7. I love that it took me a minute to figure out how to throw out my trash. A bin for recycling the plastic ware & a bin for compost-great of them to care! 
8. First burger of 2010 has kick started my craving for more burgers! 
9.*Sniffs fingers* Ok maybe I secretly like the stale stench of bacon and onions...
10. P.S. Cash only! Man its 2010-*cough debit card cough*
author: Catherine O.

description:
Burgermeister has "diner charm" without leaning on a nostalgic interior.  The staff was pleasant and helpful and while the place is small, it felt comfortable.  There was also good music playing.

I ordered a California burger (comes with avocado and jack cheese), and fries, with a soda.  They definitely hit the spot and tasted great.  I think I spent a little more than I would have expected to spend at a burger spot, but overall I was pretty happy with it.

On my way out I noticed maybe two tables set up outside, with a couple occupying one - so they do have a very small amount of outdoor seating at times.
author: Matt M.

description: Big fan!  They seem to have revamped their menu recently and I'm impressed! Lots to choose from and you can even get a tasty salad...although it's hard to be healthy when the wafts of garlic fries are in the air. Milkshakes are good too. The staff are always upbeat and friendly!!
author: Clare C.

description:
Had my hubby order me a Pastrami (NEW) burger after he called to say that our lunchtime pickup at May's Sandwich Shop was not to be (they are closed on Monday).

Not at all pleased with this burger. The peppercorn sauce tasted fake? processed? salad-dressing-like? I'm not sure how to describe it, but there's something fast-foody about the taste which overpowered any of the other flavours in the sandwich. 

Add to that the high price tag of a Burgermeister burger - just not quite there.
author: Scott B.

description: Sometimes it's good. Sometimes it's burnt. But the Colossal Burger is big enough for two people. Been going here once a week for years.
author: Becky W.

description:
Sure this place isn't cheap, and yes you will need to drop about $15 for a burger, fries, and a drink but it's worth it.  If you're not feeling like a burger definitely try out the grilled chicken breast or the turkey burger.  The fries here are great but I'm also a fan of the cole slaw and there's something really yummy about the salad dressing here as well.  

Bottom line, expensive but if you want something that is reliable and delicious this is your place.
author: Adam P.

description:
When I go to any food establishment for the first time, especially a burger joint, I like to order the biggest, baddest thing on the menu. In this case, it is the Meister Burger.

I am a burger critic. I have eaten at all the local burger restaurants in SF. I even lived across the street from Pearl's for a year, but would still venture all the way to the Castro for this king. The Meister Burger truly is a masterpiece, and I say this because it's the only burger I have ever had that was abnormally large but didn't fall apart when I picked it up. Every bite, and I mean every last one, was perfectly balanced with delicious beef, avocado, onions, cheese and mushrooms. I devoured the entire thing, and felt 100% satisfied as I did so. I even said to my girlfriend, "This is the best burger I have ever had."

The prices are higher than average, but the quality is much higher than average. I have never had a bad experience here in at least two-dozen visits. They actually cook the burgers over an open flame (a lot of places are fond of griddles). The beef is perfect. I eat my burgers medium-rare, and they executed that more precisely than I had ever seen. The buns are toasted just enough so that they are not too crunchy, but still don't get soggy from the grease. The fries are yummy, and have a nice little crunch to them. The service is fantastic. They ask for your name and bring the burgers out to you. They also never seem to be in a bad mood. Oh, they have beer! Like, six different beers on tap! There aren't many burger places with that!

I am disappointed that so many people wrote bad reviews for this place. I don't understand it. The burgers here are so phenomenal. Actually, I just reread one of the bashing reviews, and they complained about a VEGGIE BURGER. Eat some real meat, dork!

It might be expensive, but there is a price to pay for the absolute best in the city. If you like delicious, juicy and beefy specialty burgers, you will love this place. Case closed.
author: Eliot R.

description:
Came here for lunch today and I was pleasantly surprised. 

I got the Teriyaki Burger with coleslaw. For a 1/3 lb burger, the patty is really big and thick. The sliced pineapple were great compliments to the teriyaki sauce that was used liberally. The coleslaw was fantastic and tasted better than most places. 

My coworker got the Kobe Beef Steak and Cheese sandwich. He also thought it was great, but probably not the REAL Japanese Kobe beef, especially at a price of $10. 

I have also heard that the garlic fries are amazing, but I had to decline because I didn't want my breath to kick coming back from work. 

Overall this was an awesome place and the service was great. The milkshakes seemed very tasty and the other burgers seemed very appealing. The price of the burgers are higher than usual, but you definitely pay for what you get, and it's definitely worth the price.
author: Langdon N.

description: This was a great find. They use Kobe and Niman beef, everything looked and tasted fresh. My order was prepared on the spot and arrived hot. Nice people, good food slightly pricey but totally worth it.
author: Janet C.

description:
This one's going to be quick:

Dear Burgermeister-
A veggie burger should *not* cost the exact same amount as a Niman Ranch beef burger.  $9 for a Boca patty on a bun?  

Thanks but no thanks,
Katie
author: Katie M.

description:
I have such will power.

As I parked across the street at my local safeway to do some super healthy shopping, I caught a whiff of something special.

No, not the "10 day old homeless guy stale fart" smell.  The kind of smell that would force you to punch 12 old ladies just to get to.

It was a splendid combination of bacon, beef and frying oil.  

I quickly did the right thing.

I aborted all healthy options and walked across the street.

After making it home with my recently purchased burger in hand, I got caught talking to my neighbor for about 10 minutes.

Did it ruin the burger?

Oh hell no.  It created a super greasy (in a good way) amorphous blob of heavenly goodness.

Yeah, it was damned delicious.

My only two beefs (ha, get it?) with this place are

1) no credit cards (I think I am slowly losing this battle)
2) pretty damned expensive (and this is coming from the guy who bought 10 cases of Aspray just to send out as joke gifts)

Next time I go to Safeway, I am bringing nose plugs.

Will.
author: Archie R.

description:
1/2 lb, Medium, Burger with bleu cheese and jalapenoes was average; not very juicy, jalapenos had no flavor, and the roll was sub-par. The fries were excellent and the staff friendly. I will try this place again, but next time will try the burger medium-rare and maybe with just simple cheddar cheese.

Malts and chili fries looked verry tasty.
author: Dave N.

description:
I love burgers, and Burgermeister is one of my favorite places to to for a good burger. Therefore, if that's all you're really looking for, I'd check it out. Not as cheap as Super Duper, but definitely less greasy. The fact that they also serve beer is nice.

OTHERWISE, if you need the whole restaurant reviewed, here ya go:

Decor: Um, "San Franciscan?" I barely even notice. Lots of red coloring; the walls are adorned with awards, accolades, and such. Basically, "Eat here!" even though you already are.

Service: Here's where I (regretfully) ding them a star, and it's kind of tough to do. The people who take your order/cash are generally not the most friendly; in fact, it seems like they don't even really want a job there. In reality, they deal with all kinds of drunk and/or high people all day long, so I'm sure that by about noon their patience is just about shot. It's understandable, but it can sometimes tarnish one's experience, especially when it's the first thing that happens.

Bathroom: Go get the key at the counter! Seriously, 9/10 people do not know this. I even tricked myself into believing that there was already someone in there because I didn't see the key ON the counter, but they started hanging it behind the counter, just out of sight. I think too many homeless people started wandering in.

Homeless people: Yeah, it's Church and Market. They're there, and some of them will ask you for change or a cigarette.

Music: Usually a Top 40 blend from the modern era, but sometimes they trip back to the 70s for some songs that I'd forgotten or never heard of before.
author: Chris H.

description:
This place rocks. 
We were visiting from St. Louis, and our B&B was 5 blocks away.  With all the fabulous food in this city, we still managed to eat here 3 times during our stay. 
Yummers
author: Jezebelly S.

description: Oh man whenever i'm in SF i go here for my hamburgers and always get the meister burger which is the best. Milkshakes and onion rings rock! Burger are really expensive at $12 but it's not like i get one every day so when i'm in town i'll stop by a couple of times..
author: Kevin H.

description:
o hella much yes!!  So juicy and delicious!  Muahaha.  I dropped a star because I hate spending $15 on a burger and fries.

I'm currently digging the San Diego burger with chedder and jalapenos, but usually go with the blue cheese burger or the San Francisco with avocado, cheese and mushrooms (or something hippy like that).
author: Hella M.

description:
I'm new to San Francisco so never heard of this place. I was going to the Safeway on Market and Church and I was hungry (you know what they say about grocery shopping on an empty stomach) so I looked around at the eating spots around there. Burgermeister caught my eye because... well, I like burgers. 

Looked like a hole in a wall which is a plus... then I saw it was pretty full for 1:00 PM so I went to check it out. 

I ordered cheeseburger, cheeseburger, cheeseburger... OK sorry Belushi. I ordered a 1/3 pound cheeseburger with fries and a soda. Price $11+ so I thought that's pretty pricey for a small burger joint.

But when I got the cheeseburger it's looked very good. And it tasted very, very good. It was obvious they use quality meat (found out after the fact they do indeed use quality meat for their burgers). 

The cheeseburger was delicious. Cooked perfectly. Fresh lettuce and the red onions were delicious. 

The fries were good. I'm a coke fan so boo-hoo on the Pepsi only products but that's okay. The food is totally worth it even though I had to wash it down with a diet Pepsi vs. diet coke. :-)

The dude that took my order was very nice. And I liked the vibe of the place. Enjoying a good cheeseburger right by the big window facing Church street (I think) anyway the window was open. So nice breeze, good food. Yea I'm a fan and I will be back.

Since I was originally going to Safeway I just parked in their lot and crossed the street to Burgermeister. I then went back to Safeway with a full and happy belly to do my grocery shopping.

It's a perfect spot right off the Church muni and not a bad walk to my place so great location. I noticed lots of 2-hour parking and metered parking all around so very handy location.

Rock on.
author: Alan P.

description:
Just finished doing my nails (Simply Unique Nails down the street).

STARVING. 

CRAVING MEAT! I see a burger place!

I didn't care about how much it cost, I was just so hungry. I bought a cheese burger and fries. It was fresh, it was tasty, perfect. Oh, and the staff was nice. The wait for the burgers took about 7-10 minutes.
author: Sophia G.

description:
Nothing to do with fast-food! This is an awesome burger-place where you'll eat delicious meat!
Every single bucks I spent there was worth, I totally suggest to try it if you're a big fan of good meat and burgers. 
Just one thing: don't order fries with garlic...it is actually garlic with fries!
author: Luca D.

description: Great burgers, shakes and fries, and very helpful staff! We went to sit outside and a homeless/transient panhandler set up shop right across the sidewalk. We moved inside because it was a little too hot to sit outside anyway, and the cashier went outside, shooed the guy away and told us we could go back outside if we wanted. I really appreciated the gesture! The burgers are great, a little on the pricey side but not too oily and I recommend the garlic fries. Also, the shakes are like the kind you get in East coast diners... In the glass with the metal cup on the side with all the extra. YUM! I wouldn't hesitate to go back.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I can't think of anything about this place I could do to improve it . . .it's a strange feeling. Ok I just thought of one. (whew!) I would change the paintings on the wall of retro dinner-ness. They subject matter is fine but the art/skill level is just lame. 

My boyfriend and I eat here about. . . twice a month? I have thoroughly enjoyed every single meal. Particularly enjoyed the current and previous monthly milkshake specials of Pumpkin and Eggnog. They use Straus dairy and maybe Mitchell's ice cream I think? 

I love the THREE veggie burger options (garden/bocca/portobello) and big variety of perfect veggie toppings. I never have the same burger twice, and that's brilliant for a vegetarian with a meat-loving boyfriend. 

OH, and since Bun Heaven closed, this place has won my highly coveted "Best Onion Rings in Alexandria's San Francisco*" designation. 

*Alexandria's San Francisco excludes many regions of SF to which Alexandria never travels, including but not limited to the Sunset, Twin Peaks, Bayview, Chinatown, Potrero, and the Heights (any of them).
author: Alexandria N.

description:
A $9 burger that made my stomach wrench and evacuated the 1/2 of what I ate upon stepping foot into the john.  A cleaning solvent on the grill is the only logical solution (pun intended). I lost my apetite not even eating 1/2 of the burger. Fries and 2 buck wine, began to taste leaden in my mouth.   A 100 rating on cleaniliness maybe admirable, but where cleaning solvents land and accumulate is no better than seeing critters up the wall.
YUCK
author: One P.

description:
Don't order the Kobe Beef Salad. Thin, weirdly sliced pieces of beef (the kind that comes on a philly cheesesteak) are cooked on the grill and then mixed (while still piping hot!) with the rest of the salad. Of course what results is a soggy, wilted mess (even the croutons lost their crunch before I was halfway done with the salad). To top it off, it comes with a plastic fork.
One star for quality ingredients, one star for quantity of meat. I might come back and try something safe like a burger and fries.
author: Laura B.

description:
I thinked I hyped myself up a little too much for Burgermeister.

So, for about a month (or maybe even longer), my roommate and I have been passing by Burgermeister either during our commutes or after leaving Safeway. From afar it looked like something I NEEDED to try. As a result, the thought of the yet-to-be-consumed Burgermeister burger was constantly on my mind.

Finally, I ate there. My thoughts? Meh. I went on a weekday, so I was able to partake of their special, which was $9.50 for a burger (I ordered mine with cheddar), fries and a fountain drink. Not bad, but still kind of pricey if you ask me. The burger was satisfactory. I'm a pretty big burger person, and this tasted like something I could make at home. Maybe next time I'll try something a little different. Garlic fries perhaps? Bleu Cheese on my burger? Maybe mixing things up will enhance my Burgermeister experience.
author: Tatiana J.

description:
My wife is always bugging me for a Burgermeister burger. She digs the veggie options they offer while I'm never upset about having to eat here. I mean, they do have some killer burgers.
 I'm not sure what I can add that hasn't already been said about these hamburgers.
They are consistent and the staff has always been friendly with us. I know they have a beer special too but I can't recall the times or the deal...think it is $1 off drafts.
One thing I always forget and I wish they advertised them a little more....are the buffalo wings. Burgermeister actually has some great wings. Classic NY style. I will have to remember this the next time I'm bitching about SF not having any good wings.
author: Terry M.

description:
I've gone here three or four times and my burger was dry every time.  I can think of a dozen other places I'd rather eat within the same food group.... yes I said 'food group.'

It's really not a good option.  I'd rather grab a burger at In 'n Out down the Warf or at Bar Johnny's on Polk or opt for the Indian place at Kennedy's down the street.  

I suppose if I was standing outside the place and had to eat a burger within 5 minutes without the cash or capacity to drive somewhere I'd give it another shot.

In a city of foodies you really can't excuse a flagship product this mediocre.
author: Calvin N.

description: Yummy! At least the two times I've been here. They have so many options I can't just choose one thing to get. My bf really likes this place too. He called to place an order one night as we were driving around looking for food and we decided to eat here but wanted a head start with our food order. The lady who answered was really friendly, according to him. Once we got there she was still really friendly, wish I got her name. Our food was really good and we will go back for sure. Plus the portions are big and filling.
author: Jonathan R.

description: My place for good burger and fries.  Also enjoy the Chicken Wings and the Philly Cheesesteaks.  I wish there were more locations in the City.
author: Daniel P.

description: $12 for a burger and fries!! My burger came out dry and overcooked.  They took forever and it wasn't even busy. Just a huge rip off in my opinion.  Go get a Whiz burger instead. Won't be back! Gave 2 stars for quality beef, too bad they can't cook it right. Fail!
author: Vincent P.

description: I was greeted by an undercover asshole. A fat, sarcastic piece of ****. Food was bland.  I took one bite and lost my appetite. Couldn't even finish. I wish you could give no stars.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
I admit this is a long over due review but, I gotta a catch up here. 
You see for some reason a relationship only works for me if there is food and that being said I had to have a hamburger and my boy toy took me to ess eff and I knew where I wanted to be Burgermeister. 

If solely because of the chedder and fries and the scents of meat being grilled to a perfect hue of pink and grey and the buns toasted and the atmosphere of homelessness just outside but then all you see is your burger being made with pickles and mustard and cheese and more cheese and hot fries and a cool drink ...

The only thing stopping me from proposing marriage to the cook is that my boy toy was buying otherwise that cook and me would be invested in making something else besides burgers....oh yeah...
author: Patricia A.

description:
Run of the mill $12 burgers.

That's all I gotta say

And NEVER FORGET JOHN RITTER ! ! ! !
author: Mario W.

description:
Bar planning meeting at the 500 Club, followed by a brief bender at Bender's preceding an Eagles of Death Metal concert only to continue my bender at Bender's then party with Beauty Bar hipsters I meet outside of Bender's till the wee hours of the morning,  wake up before noon get busy, get to my scheduled Speakeasy Brewery tour all on an empty stomach.  Hamburger, no Cheeseburger, no, no, Bacon Cheeseburger - my mind was consumed, it was all I could think about all I wanted. Just the mere thought of pure crispy baconny, beefy, cheesy goodness hitting my lips was giving me little mouth orgasms. 

Where oh where do we go?  "Burgermiester" my friends say.  "Oh, OK, are they good?" I say. "Yes, the best".  Wah, wah, waah.  What a let down. First of all $14 for a bacon cheeseburger and fries?  Really, OK then, it better be the best damn bacon cheeseburger I've ever eaten.  But no, no, no, no, no, no ,no, it was barely mediocre. I felt robbed, in so many ways.  It was dry, bland, and it only came with two pathetic pieces of wimpy limpy bacon in a X formation.  The fries were dry too, how do you mess up fries?  The only good thing I have to say about this place is that there's a huge tub of free flowing mayo, but that's not gonna get me back here.  So now I'm out $14 and still craving a good burger, guess I'll have to wait for Tuesdays at Rosamunde for a good burger, they might not have bacon but I think I can I mange without it.
author: EVA G.

description:
A guy walks in to Burgermeister.  Her orders the Western with onion rings.  The register monkey says "That'll be $17.50."  Exsqueeze me?  "Uhhh... I don't have $17.50."  "We have an ATM."  "Uhh... I'm not about to pay $17.50 for a burger and onion rings."  

So first the Banana burger disappeared from the menu.  And now, I don't even see the specialty burgers on the menu.  Price is through the F'n roof, the kick @$$ burgers are... what... hidden?  I don't know.

I hope whatever virus this place got has not infected the other Burgermesiters... it would make baby jesus weep.  :(
author: Dan M.

description:
RUN, RUN FAR AWAY!
I was DISGUSTED with the treatment I received from someone who appeared to be the manager, or maybe he was just a power hungry *******! I think that Jeremy, Melvin and I are talking about the same guy. He is short, heavy set, with a mustache, and appears to be Latino. I am applauded at how rude he was to me. This is the first time I have ever had a bad experience at Burgermeister. It saddens me to write this review because the rest of the staff are very friendly and exemplify great customer service. I suggest this guy go to customer service 101. Sadly enough, you would get better service at McDonald's than from this guy.
author: Joan M.

description:
I was all like WHAT?! When I saw my hotdog and fries were $10.50, but once the 13" by 5" fileted dog served on a loaf sized bun I instantly forgot about the price. 

This place is great tasting and a cool place to hang with friends.
author: Brett R.

description: The San Francisco burger is awesome. Topped with mushrooms, and feta cheese. Good fries too. About the only complaint I have is the lack of exhaust. The exhaust system over the grills and burners are not properly purging out the grease and fumes.
author: Shane P.

description:
Decent place to soak up all the alcohol in your system after happy hour at Orbit Room or Pisco Lounge. The basic 1/2 pound beef burger ($9) comes with a choice of salad or regular fries. Your costs will start to increase significantly with all the upgrades and add-ons (cheese, bacon, curly fries, etc.).  You can get out of here for ten bucks if you order just a plain burger and have water with your sandwich.

Last night's burger was not one of the better ones I've had here. The bun was soggy before the burger made it over to me. They should have grilled the bun to handle all the juices.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Good place to go if you want a nice greasy burger. Fries are good too.
author: Christopher C.

description: Excellent burger shop! Friendly atmosphere, top of the line quality of food. Honestly just perfect! Little pricey though
author: Robert G.

description: So I get stabby when I am hungry, so my friends fearing for their lives dragged me in for a snack before dinner.  The snacks were chili cheese fries, garlic fries and onions rings.  The garlic fries were tasty and so were the onion rings.  The chili cheese fries made me not want to head to dinner but to order another round for me.
author: Megan P.

description:
I'm not even going to lie: I go here often. It's basically my go-to burger joint.  I think that is both because I don't know any better and because I like the hood it's in. 

What's so good? 
Their burgers are cooked just how you like them and there is a vast array of toppings/sauces- that is all

BAD:
-French fries are comparable to burger king's.  This is fine if you cost as much as BK.
-Speaking of cost, it's friggin expensive
-My friend recently ate a grilled chicken sandwich and vomited shortly after (no he wasn't intoxicated) and still has a tummy ache.  YES it was from you MEISTER.
author: Josie A.

description:
We walked into the taqueria next door and walked right back out. After a day of being frequented by Pride Celebration merrymakers, the 4.5 Yelp stars meant nothing. The spot smelled liked: 

a) a dirty swimming pool locker room gone sour, 
b) sweaty, unshaven armpits, 
c) Cholula [http://www.cholula.com/] - according to our companion from Albuquerque. 

We walked into Burgermeister. We tilted our heads back, and we sniffed. Beef. Beef. Beef. Thank goodness!

The bacon dog half consumed earlier at the Pride Celebration was still sitting in my stomach, so I only ordered curly fries [Nice kick to them. Ask for Ranch!] and a shake [strawberry]. Portions are generous, even on those items. I tried many times to pawn off the curly fries to my friends who were already struggling with their orders. The $5+ shake was delicious, and it was really the size of 2.25 shakes. No complaints! The burgers my friends had ordered [1 each] were size-of-your-face-HUGE. 

Don't get thrown off by the prices. You're getting fresh ingredients, happy Niman Ranch cows, and enough food to feed a Lego village. They don't have Garden or turkey burgers, but for the veggie types who can stand the smell of beef [or at least prefer it over the other smells mentioned], they do have portabello and boca burgers.

Cash only! And how convenient, there is an ATM sitting right inside!
author: Tinna H.

description:
From the day this place opened (2004 or '05?) until the day I moved away 1.5 years ago, I ate here approximately twice/week.  I lived right around the corner on Duboce.
The best burgers I've ever had.  I've brought many friends.  They say the same thing.  

Each week I got a Bacon Cheesburger with Swiss, medium rare one day and the Chicken Cheese Steak another day.  I tried other things too, but these were my staples.  They use Niman Ranch beef, which is wonderful to begin with.  They cook it exactly as you order it, and I mean exactly.  

Their fries, ahhh, their fries...  Their regular fries are really good.  Their curly fries are better.  Their garlic fries?  Legions of vampires have been vanquished by a single order of their garlic fries.  They saute copious amounts of freshly chopped garlic in a little bit of oil, then pour the whole mix over your freshly deep-fried potatoes.

The cheese steaks are not like what you'll find on the east coast, so don't expect that, but they still very very good.

They always hire friendly, helpful and very capable people.  Obviously, they all got to know me very well, and knew what I was going to order before I walked through the door.  When I get back to SF, I'm going to eat nothing but sushi and these burgers.

- When are you going to open one up here in Hawaii???  Come on, you know you want to.
author: Bill T.

description:
They do some damn fine work with burgers here. Damn fine. The burgers here are massive and they've got some great speciality items. They actually have an amazing take on Carl Jr's western burger. I went in there hungry one night and ended up entering a food coma after ordering a double burger, buffalo wings, chili fries and a milk shake. I think I'm still digesting that meal. I may have been near death but it was worth it, no doubt. 

My only reason for not hitting these guys with a fifth star are the prices. I'm a firm believer that you get what you pay for but, be ready to spend some cash to get a burger, fries and a drink here. You'll be stuffed but it'll cost you. I will admit, if you're jonesing for a real good cheeseburger, it'll be worth it, for sure.
author: Andy A.

description:
I totally used a friend of mine last night and was like "let's go to Burgermeister" but really meant "OMG, you have a car and this place is right across the street from Safeway and I really need to pick up a few things OMG I can't believe I bought so much stuff be a dear and put this in the trunk for me."

Anyways.  We walked into Burgermeister and "In Your Eyes" by Peter Gabriel was playing.  I seriously broke out into song.  Like old school musical breaking into song with wild hand gestures and lots of choreography.  Fortunately the cashier joined in (+ 1 star)!!

This place is pretty expensive.  My cheeseburger with curly fries was like $13.  I don't know how that's possible.  Still, it was pretty tasty.  While waiting I examined the condiments and my friend called me a "condiment whore."  I don't know what that means and I really don't care to know.

Also, my dining companion got a turkey burger and a salad.  Meanwhile I was like "Can I get a side of grease please?"  Ugh.  I'm a big girl at heart.
author: Evan L.

description:
What does a 35 year old healthy and clean living woman, with a simple life of close friendships and a loving family do when a funky panda calls on a Sunday night asking to stop by after 36 hours of partying?  

Here's the phone conversation:

"Ring Ring"

Funky Panda:  "Hey, what are you doing?"  

Me:  "I'm putting my oatmeal and yogurt in my lunch bag for work tomorrow, setting my coffee machine on self timer for the morning, and I'm about to brush my teeth."

FP:  "I'm in your neighborhood and wanted to see if I could stop by."

Me:  "Um, it's Sunday night and I'm about to go to bed.  What's wrong with you?  You sound one can away from a RedBull four pack."  

FP:  "I've been at these parties with these people and they're still partying and I was thinking about you."

Me:  (I'm too old for this) "Oy, fine come over."

When this happens, you take the disco angel to Burgermeister for some proper after party sustenance.  You order him a double bacon cheeseburger, fries, and a coca cola.  You sit and help eat his fries while listening to him talk about complete nonsense.  You give him a reassuring look that says you care but, you tell him this is not acceptable, nor is it amusing.  He nods/shakes his head like a little kid because he understands and then holding the burger with two hands, takes the biggest nosh eyes closed and all.   You then take him home, make him shower and brush his teeth, and then tuck him into bed.

Burgermeister is just the place for a scenario like this.  

Best fries ever!
author: James M.

description: One of the best burger joints I've been to....fast and friendly service to go along with unbelievably good burgers. The place is a dive, but clean and full of character, with  plenty of seating. The prices are a little high, however, the quality of food more the justifies the pricing. Highly recommended if you jones'n for a burger....
author: Michael A.

description:
So, I started smoking pot again (thanks to my loser boyfriend!), which isn't as weird as it sounds.  As an ex-stoner, I still frequently played the, "ohmygod, this ________ is so delicious, I can't even imagine how exponentially and insanely better it would taste if I were stoned" game.  But now I can play it for reals!  Pizza is just ridiculously good! Tacos with fresh lime juice drizzled on top? Duuuuuuuuuuuude. Thai currys with tofu and a generous dose of  heat? Holy christ, they're almost painfully awesome.

Let's just say that I am incredibly amped to smoke some weed with my super dude and head over to ye olde Burgermeister for a veggie burger loaded with jack cheese and avocado, hold the ketchup (barf), but slather on the hot sauce and BBQ sauce (yes, I know it's essentially the same thing as ketchup. Go fuck yourself), pour me a cold Stella and all the sudden this stoned atheist has been transported to heaven!

It's really upsetting that this is what my life has become. More french fries, please.
author: Chloe S.

description:
Okay.. i just finished my burger, so the flavor is not just some past recollection. I still got grease all over my face. Hope this makes for a more accurate review. I'm also a total meat eater. RAWR.

So, being entirely new to this SF scene I decided to take the plunge and eat at the famed Burgermeister, as suggested by my classmate. 

I was debating on what to get so my instincts just led me to The Meister Burger... Omg.. let me just say, sometimes less is more. It comes with 1/2 lb of beef, avocado, cheese, onions, lettuce, tomatoes, mushrooms, bacon and I think that's it. Oh and a side of fries. 

First bite was good, 2nd bite was good too... and then by 3rd, I just wanted to finish the rest of the burger. Those flavors are tasty only for so long. Having to chow down on it for 10 minutes isn't fun. Half way through, it no longer felt enjoyable and I just started forcing myself to eat the 14 dollars I spent on it .

It was a monstrosity, by the time I finished my entire hand was covered in grease. I

The flavors weren't WOW quality, the meat was pretty juicy, and the fries were probably the best part of the meal. 

I tried their garlic fries and their shakes a week earlier and thumbs down dude. Garlic fries were just soaking in oil with chopped garlic.... boring. And their shakes.. I got a neopolitan shake (straw, vanil, and choco) and it sucked. It was watery, and instead of getting chocolate ice cream, it was chocolate syrup.... no. no no no. 

I don't know.. i still prefer my fuddruckers or In-n-out man. Yes, i like those CHAINS. 

And yes, i do sense an overall anti food chain attitude. I'm no Mc. D fan but... i'm not a fan of burgermeister either.
author: Eugenia Y.

description:
Portobello mushroom burger with fries.  HOLY CRAP THAT'S TASTY.  

Don't make the "health-conscious mistake" of ordering the slaw -- it ain't that good.

That one time where they forgot to make my food and I sat around hungry for about 20 minutes: the Burgermeister blokes made it up to me with a few pints of beer!
author: jack p.

description: I just wanted to update this to five stars. I've been a ton of times since my first review and now I can't figure out why I didn't give them 5 stars before. The food is consistently great and the staff is super friendly and nice. I love this place.
author: Christy S.

description:
Good burgers, staff was rocking out to DJ Shadow and having a good time and still serving customers with professionalism. That is always cool. Burgers were good but not the best ever and for the price I am not going to eat them all the time. But the chocolate malt was so good; I felt guilt (a rare and strange feeling). 

Total price for 2 people was $23.83.
author: Brendan R.

description: We just happened to notice this place out of the corner of our eye while coming out of Safeway across the street and went for it. SO THANKFUL WE DID! The service was friendly and helpful. The food was super good! My boyfriend had the Philycheese steak and its all he keeps talking about. I had the California on wheat bun..It was yummylicious! I am taking him back for a second round before we go back home to Sacramento.
author: Angela M.

description:
It's a decent place to eat in or do take out. Is functional, service is good and the food is OK. Cleanliness, ambience and location... eh.

1. The menu is the same as the BM in Cole Valley... so are the prices. :)

2. If I'm in the hood and am in the mood to eat burger meat, and don't feel like waiting for the the N Judah a.k.a. the Never-Never Coming Judah, then I hit this place up.

3. The food here just seems a bit... limp? Have comes across fries that have been kind of soggy, the burger bun just seems to fall apart leaving me wondering if the lower part of my face is paralyzed and do I have drool pouring out the corner of my lips.. ish sthat sho? Milks shakes are decent. Food has been hit or miss for me.

4. Don't get me wrong, its a good place to eat. But if you've been a frequent eater at the BM in Cole Valley, you'll find it difficult to adjust to this one in terms of taste and location.

5. Watch out walking out that you don't trip over some of the sidewalk squatters  lest you want burger over your chest and milk shake on your face.

6. They don't take cash (like all other BMs), so bring cash with you or be willing to withdraw at the ATM inside but it charges you $2 for the withdrawal.

7. The fact that its lower than street level can make the air a bit oppressive inside... sort of like when you were in the Transfer... air gets heavier the further back you go in.

All in all, I'm still a fan of the BM in Cole Valley but don't mind stopping by here if I am in the vicinity and the gods of hunger are stampeding in my stomach.
author: Amit S.

description:
You can take the kid out of Texas but you can't take Texas out of the kid.  I have to pay my respects to the best place for a burger that I have yet to find in this concrete jungle.  I usually go here for lunch on sunny days and sit either on the sidewalk or in the window just checking out the scene on Church.  It's really mellow for lunch just the way I like it.  

The burgers are top quality.  The condiments are good, the fries are perfect.  I can't think of any negatives about this place.  Screw the wait for a burger, they have The Onion newspapers to keep me completely occupied and chuckling the whole time.  

If you love a good, no frills burger and fries this place trumps the others in its class.
author: ashton c.

description: These people know how to cook up a mean ass burger. and by that I mean its the kind of burger that will put you straight into a deep, deep food coma afterwards! the bacon cheeseburger and avocado cheeseburger are my favorites. aside from burgers, I love their buffalo chicken wings as well. not sure if they still have them, but they had 50cent wings nights, which is AWESOME :)
author: Jennie L.

description:
I always order the kid's burger.  Always.  Try as I might, I cannot comfortably finish their regular burgers.  So if you're like me and you want a decent meaty, carby meal with close to no nutritional content for about $6, check out Burgermeister.  I have to say, though, that my favorite thing to eat at Burgermeister is not their burgers, but their chocolate malted shake.  Man, it's like diabetes in a glass, but they do not skimp on the malt; and oh how I love my malt.

Oh, they have brunch now.  It's not so good.  Okay, I'm taking half a point off for the disappointing brunch.  3.5 stars for Burgermeister.
author: Diana Y.

description:
I have long been awaiting to have happy hour at this Burgermeister.  Like everyone says, it is Expensive!  But during happy hour which is Monday through Friday 4-7 you can get any of their beers on tap for $2.75 that includes, Fat Tire, Anchor Steam, Prohibition, Sierra Nevada and a few more.  But that's a pretty good deal plus they have a happy hour menu, which includes on Monday's $6 for the appetizer platter but this ends at 6 pm.  So I got no food and ate off my friends amazing curly chili cheese fries and big avocado and onion ring burger or that's what it looked like.  So I was fine!  

Like said, there is an ATM, but when I checked my bill today, I got charged $2 by the machine and then again another $2 by Bank of America and normally I find them to be a great bank but that pissed me off.  

But I will be back to  Burgermeister in the near future for more happy hour fun.  And I also discovered my love for Cholula and ketchup which was worth the trip itself!
author: Megan L.

description:
My boyfriend and I absolutely love this place. We both can't recall a time where we've had a "bad experience." The food is always great, it's pricey but it's worth every bite. We love the bacon cheeseburgers(and bbq sauce), cripsy french fries and cold dr. pepper- and this place never fails to satisfy. 

Today my family came to visit and we had to give them mad props for accommodating for a large group like ours (ten people).

Oh we will come back again, and again and again,
author: Lauren S.

description: I had the Bocca burger (veggie patty), it was OK. The fries were quite nice, and I enjoyed the sauces that came with them. I guess this is a place you'd probably enjoy more if you're a meat eater. The service wasn't the friendliest but not rude either.
author: Nora G.

description:
I'd had a craving for a burger for the past few days.  Situations including friend visits, a lost wallet, and sheer unbridled laziness all prevented me from reaching my goal of putting a burger in my stomach.  Well that changed today, on attempt #2 to reach Burgermeister.  Why did I choose this place?  I wanted to go for something new, and this place conveniently fit that criteria.

So i got there, ordered me a cheeseburger, curly seasoned fries, and a beer, paid a million dollars for the food, then waited to take that first "mission accomplished" bite.  Well then I did, and the burger was....(this is oh-so climatic).....the burger was eh.   Yeah, kinda disappointing . It wasn't bad, it just wasn't...well, four star worthy.  In other news, the fries were a tasty bunch, and the Hefeweizen beer, well that didn't let me down.

This Burgermeister was a fairly clean establishment, decent interior, and a few tables.  And now for two complaints: this place doesn't take cash (seriously restaurants, get with it, deal with the fees) and their bathroom requires a key.  Just minor annoyances.  But this is Yelp, and by golly, I sure am gonna bitch about em.  

The food wasn't bad...it really was "a okay", but kinda expensive for such an impression, and while I may return, I'd head to Burger Joint, among others, first.
author: Charles R.

description:
I remember the really good, juicy, fatty burgers I used to eat while I lived in NYC.  You cut the burger in half and beef juice soaked into the toasted bun.  Pommes frites were always served in a paper cone cup, cooked crisp to perfection in salty, oily splendor.   You relished every bite and hoped it would never end.  

I had a stressful day so what better relief than to order a glass of generic cab and a juicy burger at a place called "BurgerMeister"?  I even ordered garlic fries with that.  But...  there were six of us at table and we all ordered different degrees of done-ness and all of us had our beef cooked exactly the same:  rubbery brown.  Blagh.  When I had them recook my order, it was no better than the first pile of mess.  

And the garlic fries...can we talk about the garlic fries?  They use garlic out of the jar that's been fermenting in it own juice.   You can smell is a few feet away.   Yeah, you foodies know the smell I'm talking about.  Its smell borders on kimchee.  Not so good on fries.
author: Tom K.

description: Got the steak with blue cheese, onions and I had mine on a whole wheat bun. Thanks for offering healthier options btw. The meat was well seasoned, my side salad fresh and I would def go back. Yum!
author: Erika A.

description:
Good burgers, fries & extras. It's my second buger/fry experience in a week, so i'm beginning to become quite a fan. Maybe it's because all the celebs are ging to Mc Donald's lately... but I'm not ready for that yet.
Anyway, I love the veggie choices of Boca, Garden, or Mushroom Burgers at Burgermeister! And... how smart is it that they give you fries as a side option with any burger! 
So, recently we went in late night. Their ATM machine was out and we only had $25 dollars between 2 us. We managed to get our meals and beers for under that price (one of the cashiers hooked us up with an extra stella!) what a sweetheart!
So far, it's the best veggie burger & fry place in the city....but my search will continue.
author: Nicole L.

description:
1 star off for having huge portions that don't taste that great. The only flavor is that of the char from the grill. The bun is nice, but doesn't make up for lack of seasonings on the pattie.

1 star off for being overpriced. The burgers are almost $9 each -- and you want cheese? That's extra cash. Onion rings? Hand over another $5.25. It's almost as if they make extra big burgers and dogs simply to justify the extra big prices. I'd much rather have smaller servings and smaller prices. 

1 star off for lame vegetarian offerings. The garden burger is right off the Safeway shelf variety. And the Boca? It's same as you get in the store only larger, but 50% of the time they're out of it. For a truly great, homemade veggie pattie, head 3 blocks south on Church St to "Morning Due" bistro. Their house made lentil burger is tastier than beef (and yes, I am an omnivore).

The condiment selection is, however, great. You'll need it though: the grill is about the only flavor you'll taste unless you douse your food with sauces. In N Out does a better job of crafting a flavor.

Don't bother with the side salad. For 9 bucks, you'd think you'd get something decent. Nope. It's just a few spring mix leaves tossed on the plate. Plain and dull. The cole slaw?

One final negative: no credit cards accepted? You'd think that a place where it costs $15 to eat a burger and onion rings would take something more than just cash. Nope. And that's lame too, but I can't take off another star because it's not that crappy of a joint.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I forget about Burgermeister, maybe because I try to avoid the Safeway across the street and pretty much the whole area around the Transfer.

I went back to Burgermeister yesterday with friends for lunch and was pleased and impressed.  The burger was outstanding.  The fries were also excellent.  It's a bit pricey, and service seemed slow yesterday, but it was worth the wait.

Too bad it's cash only.  Regardless, Burgermeister is back on my list.

(Is Burgermeister really in the Michelin Guide?!)
author: Daniel S.

description:
While walking back from Imagiknit to the N Judah line, my friend and I were starving and looking for food. Our choices were: Crepevine, "that burger place (Burgermeister)" and 2 Mexican joints- 1 crowded, and the other, not so much. Being fry lovers, we chose Burgermeister. 

For 2 cheeseburgers and 2 fountain sodas, we paid $24. I thought that was a little much for an average burger. It's nice that they use quality beef for the patties, but I thought they were sort of tasteless. The fries were good, but not that good, and the ranch dressing tasted funny. 

They do have about 6 condiments at each table though, which is nice. Heinz ketchup, Grey Poupon, yellow mustard, Worcestershire sauce, A1 steak sauce (?) and Tabasco. 

I prefer Jersey Joe's in San Carlos for a good burger and fries. Otherwise, I wish they had lemonade!
author: Amy D.

description: They take credit cards now, but are still over priced.  It shouldn't cost $20 for a burger with onion rings and a fountain drink.  That's a $13-14 meal tops.
author: Robert S.

description:
I was at Lucky 13 when I was overcome with hunger due to a new 'diet' that I was trying out.  I really wanted something to eat badly.  REALLY badly.  My friends all knew about my diet and wouldn't let me go get anything to eat.  Great guys, thanks.

That is when is struck me.  I'll lie!  Yes, a tall tale.  With a wink, a smile and the excuse that I was going to buy a pack of smokes I jammed up Church Street to this place.

God damn that was a great burger and fries.  I think that it was a bit too pricey but they had quality and the food was out fast.  Only bad part, kind of messy (maybe I added to many 'extras') and when I had burger juice all over my hands and face my fib was called.  It was worth it.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too expensive.  NOT WORTH IT AT ALL!

I got a turkey burger and fries.  I bought my boyfriend a shake for his missing wisdom teeth.  I spent around $20 if I recall.  They also don't take credit cards but of course have an ATM that charges a $2 fee!  

The food is good but not even close to worth that much.  I will not be back unless they drop prices drastically

P.S.  I know we are in tough times, you're talking to one of the 455,000 who is unemployed right now.  The prices DO NOT to be this high to make ends meet.  It's highway robbery.
author: Angela S.

description:
Oh man. I wish I were there right now. Eatin' a burger, drinking a beer. 

The menu says they use Niman Ranch beef, and I don't really know what that means, but I heard it means that eating their burgers is basically like eating broccoli with crushed vitamin pills sprinkled on top--in terms of how good it is for you. I think that's how it works. Yes, red meat, as we all know, is basically poison and instant death most of the time. But for reasons that I can't remember, if if you see the words "Niman Ranch" anywhere in the restaurant, that means that every burger you eat there adds five days on to your life. Five juicy, tender, succulent days, covered in avocado and maybe A1 sauce. 

Throw in a glass of cool, nutritious beer and you are basically immortal if you eat there enough.
author: Tim S.

description:
An indulgence: the double cheeseburger with bacon.

I love how they try to health it up by talking about the organic meat, all natural ingredients, cole slaw made every hour, etc.  It doesn't really matter!  I'm getting a huge, delicious burger!  Most likely with a side of curly fries.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Burgers are flawless.  The Turkey Burget is IMO the best hands down in the Bay Area.  

Garlic Fries (great) Curly Fries (exceptional) regular fries (memorable) Onion Rings (OMG Good).  

Cashiers are pretty cool, but they definitely move at their own pace.  

Cash only, so hit the ATM!
author: jim a.

description: So the burgers here are a little on the expensive side and greasy side as well.  But if you are eating a burger, you can't expect it to be too healthy.  Taste wise, it was delicious.  I ordered off of the customized menu while my bf went with his usual, the california burger with avo.  He got a side of fries and I got the curly.  Since the portion is huge, we could have ordered one and shared, but we both are greedy when it comes to food, so naturally and as usual, we each ordered our own and went home with leftovers.
author: Young N.

description: Ordered two Meister Burgers (topped with avocado, bacon, pickled onions, and cheese) - his with fries, mine with coleslaw - and shared a small chocolate shake. Tab was close to $30, which is pretty high for a burger joint, but the taste of the food made up for it. Burgers were cooked perfectly, fries crisp, and coleslaw fresh. The chocolate shake was yummy too -- wish it could have been a tad larger. We like how there are an assortment of condiments available at each table (ketchup, regular mustard & Grey Poupon, BBQ sauce, A-1 sauce, Tabasco), and plenty of napkins. It's a small space with a lot of seating - tables/chairs, and barstools. We were here at peak time so it was pretty crowded and noisy. Probably won't be making this our regular pit stop for burgers, but it's a good option for a food splurge when we're craving for some good beef.
author: Elaine W.

description: I'm not sure it's my favorite burger place in the city, still looking.  I would say the burgers are as good as Taylor's Refresher (which might not mean much if you think that place is all hype anyways) for the same price.  But not better than Bistro Burger which is dollars cheaper.  I think the fries are better than at Burger Joint at Valencia.  So all in all, probably the best burger place for the area but not the city.  I can say for the price, I could not finish all my burger and fries.  But it could have something to do with the milkshake.
author: Jean K.

description:
The best burgers I've had in my short time in San Francisco.  The fries and slaw are pretty darn good too.  But do yourself a favor and avoid the salads.

Expensive, you say?  If you really think so, just stick to your Burger King and McDonalds and stop complaining.  They're pricier for a reason: quality.
author: Joshua K.

description:
Fail.

So I understand that as a vegetarian I've got half a leg to stand on reviewing a burger joint, but it isn't too tough to grill up a veggie patty and make it somewhat decent with a good bun, some nice leafy lettuce, a few slices of tomato and crisp onion (read: the grilled cheese & In n Out).

Still, the fries were quite good and the condiment variety almost makes up for the so-so burger (by dousing thoroughly in a chalula/mayo mix).  

In SF there is no excuse for not being able to mix up a decent homemade veggie patty rather than using boca/garden burgers.

Maybe when I get back on the meat wagon I'll check this place out - until then Zeitgiest will have to suffice.
author: Mat K.

description:
My favorite place to get a turkey burger!!  Cute little location, super great burgers, tall tables in the back, and Anchor Steam on tap.  What more could you ask for?  I often times will stop off the N Judah and get a burger on the way home.  It's a tiny bit pricey but the quality of the burgers make up for it.

Only downside is that they don't take credit cards :(


UPDATE: They now take credit cards so no down sides at all!  Oh, and their wings are the greastest!!!
author: Steve P.

description:
My quest for the best burger in the Bay continues...

It's laudable that they use Niman's Ranch beef, which certainly should be better quality than most burgers out there, but I'm a little disappointed about the prices.  $9 or more for a burger is still hard for me to swallow.  I guess I've been spoiled living in other cities where food isn't so expensive.

If it's going to cost me $15 for a beer, burger, and fries, then it better be amazingly good, but this was just better than average.  I'm still not sure the price is worth the quality, which is the basis for my evaluation.  I'd give them only 3 stars, but I appreciate this isn't beef from a feedlot with cows full of nasty chemicals.

Money aside, it's pretty tasty though the service has been spotty at best.
author: Surf R.

description:
So, okay, the burgers are good and all, but way too expensive for what you get.  I understand that the fries (or sides) are included in the price, but I don't always want that.  Just give me my burger and I'm happy--no need for nothin' else.
The shakes are good too, but same problem, just cost too much.  This place pales in comparison to joints like Pearl's, where the burgers are amazing, the sweet potato fries make you want to cry (Burgermeister doesn't even have sweet potato fries), and UNLIMITED pickles!  I think I'll head back there next time.
Oh yea, and cash only sucks.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I can't speak for their burgers as I have never tried one.  Having had some wings (one of which landed smack dab in the middle of my sweater: sauce and all-ugh!) for half price last night I can say they were okay.  Yep, just okay, I mean certainly not super meaty or anything.  The sauce had a decent kick to it, but nothing Buffalo NY would take pride in...  The chicken Philly sandwich was good, but I was really hungry so that could have impacted my opinion of it.  

The steak fries were excellent; crispy and golden goodness!
author: Catrinel A.

description:
Guilty pleasure, you are Burgermeister! The veggie burgers are way too big and I eat every last delicious bite. The fries are some of the best I've ever tasted in my life, and just thinking about them right now at 9 AM makes me want to run out in my bathrobe and order a large. It's a bit pricey, but you certainly get what you pay for, and the beers are cheap so it all balances out. 

The last time I ate there, I was coming from happy hour at Lucky 13 (it's right around the corner) and I was feeling a little enhanced. After waiting in line for the bathroom in front of a guy that had to pee super-bad, it was my turn. Wouldn't you know it, I locked the key in there! Boy was he pissed. So don't be like me, always remember the key!
author: Stumbalina b.

description:
The burgers are goooood. The onion rings are goooood. They have beer on tap, which my boyfriend likes. The service is efficient and friendly. It's right across from the Castro Safeway. So when you are completely out of food, you can go here first so you are not crazy starving while you are grocery shopping.

I wish they had brewed ice tea, not the yuck in the fountain. Other than that, it's pretty great.
author: Kristen H.

description:
Church and Duboce, they have another weather than the rest of the city. It's called Beef Patty Fog. I feel like I'm wasting my time sheding 600 cals at 24hr. I should be here instead. Dammit. 

I start becoming suspicious that it is a conspiracy. I bet they have a fog machine on the rooftop that produces the smell of their grilled beef patty. I have to steal that.
author: Perry S.

description:
Food was nothing special and over priced but the only burger spot I know of around that area.  I had my worst customer service experience here.  One employee has guaranteed that I will never visit again and will also convince my friends to do the same.  

Ok so I'm from Ohio and was in the area starving for a burger.  As I walked in the narrow corridor I approached the cash register.  I saw one employee behind the counter cleaning the counter area.  We made eye contact for a strange awkward 10 seconds.  I was expecting to be greeted but he just turned his back to me and continued cleaning.  Two minutes later as I am still standing occasionally glancing at the clock above, the cleaning associate finally put down his rag and approached me.  As he got closer I could see the dirty looking employee covered in tattoos and frizzy hair that look like his hair contained an ecosystem.  He walked to the cash register very unwillingly and just stared at me without saying a word.  I asked him, "Sir Can I place an order?"  Than he said very quickly, "What do you want?"  I am very agitated by now so I just order the cheeseburger.  He began to ring it up on my card but he said my card was declined after trying several times.  So I just left still upset with the whole situation and his attitude.  I walked across the street to the Safeway and my card worked fine.

I was intent on never going back but it was the only burger place I knew of near by.  A week later I traveled back to this place and as soon as I walked in, a young female cashier immediately began to help me.  She ran my card through several times and the same result occurred during my first visit.  However instead of refusing me service, she hand keyed my card information into the system and it accepted my card.  Very strange I thought but I was impressed at how the cashier resolved the situation.  Two thumbs up to her for excellent service!

Ok so I figure I will not let that one rude guy ruin my experience I will make this my favorite lunch spot.  So I return after another week and guess who is back at the cash register.  Yes the dirty unkempt long hair rude guy.  Ok the same problem occurs during my order.  I told him that he may have to hand key it in like the other employee before he swiped it.  Instead of listening to me he attempts to swipe my card multiple times.  Seeing that it did not work he began to type it in.  He appeared very agitated as he firmly pressed each key to the point you would think that his finger must surely be in pain.  Then at the end of the typing he stared at the screen for a moment and then said it was declined and I would have to leave.  I asked him to try it again because this was the only place I had problems with my card, and his fellow employee was able to get it to work.  Instead of trying again, he yelled the word "DECLINED" using 5 syllables instead of two as the whole restaurant got quiet and stared.

Not sure why my card has problems here but I am sure they lost a customer that would have called that place lunch home several times a week.  Poor Customer service!
author: Michael G.

description:
All I know from the judgement of my friends that we all came to the conclusion that we hated Sparky's diner, never eat there!
We came to Burgermeister for dinner and guess what? We went from feeling like depressed hungry people into feeling like champions! 
At least we weren't able to finish our meals because they were huge, and that's a good thing!
Please don't support Burma burgers at places like Sparkys but enjoy real American glory at Burgermeister! ^_^
author: Jon-o G.

description:
Despite the mastery of the burger, I'd say Burgermeister also has a decent shot at being a grand master of the Chilidog ($6.25) as well. I actually went with the turkey dog version, which was a foot long, covered with delicious chili, onions and cheese, and even came with a side of tasty cole slaw (you can get fries intsead).

The service is a little lackadasical, but it's all good, because you also get to watch the spillover from nearby bars like The Transfer, Pilsner Inn, and the Mint, truly an eclectic and eccentric clientele. I guess burgers and dogs are the great equalizer.
author: Nish N.

description:
Best burger in town, hands down; you can taste the grill on it . Dan L. is right -- the Kid's Burger is big enough to satisfy most non-trough eaters. The malted shakes and the wings are good too. 

I like my garlic fries with the garlic less raw, but they ain't bad either.

Whether you're mousy or mountainous, come hungry.
author: Karsten P.

description:
I just got done with a grueling 4hour Krav Maga martial arts test to get to the next level.  After the calorie burning fiesta I was star-ar-ar-ar -ving!!!  My test partner recommended Burgermeister and I was down for the count.

I rewarded myself to a bacon cheeseburger and fries.  Nothing tasted so good!  Nice and juicy Niman Ranch meat, nicely cooked bacon and good ole' fashioned cheddar cheese.  Fries were crispy and tasty.  Dee-light-ful!!!

Why 4 stars?
1) you get prompt and fast service of the burger
2) that said burger was incredibly tasty
3) the dude working the counter was cute, friendly, and charming
4) the burger met all your expectations and left you completely satisfied.
author: Jenn A.

description:
We had ordered burgers for lunch today from this place and it was terrible.  Our burgers (8) of them were small and cold, the fries were cold and soggy, the drinks were ok.  We ordered them at 11:30am and picked them up at 11:45am, got back to the office at noon and these lunches were cold, the buns were dry and no condiments so thjey were cold and dry butgers, and oh small, cold, dry and thin "Like McDonalds .99 cent hamburger. One I could say is that it wasn't greasy and dripping oil everywhere, no condiments so that wasn't dripping either.  And they were consistent becuase they were all the same.  Gets ONE Star from me.

I had the North Beach & West Lake Burgers and were both great, don't know what they do here but it ain't right.
author: gordon g.

description:
This place is so ridiculously overpriced. Sure, the burgers are good, but definitely not worth the price.

In general, I also think the whole Niman Ranch beef thing is overrated, but I don't feel like getting into that now.

If it's not too late, walk to KK cafe on Divisadero at Haight.
author: Mark A.

description:
This place gets 5 stars because they do burgers the way they should be.  I love to grill but this place is as good as grilled burgers get.  I love just walking by the place to enjoy the great aroma of burgers on the grill. 

So how do you achieve the perfect burger.  1) The meat - it great quality, perfectly seasoned and then seared on their smoking hot grill.  They also do a great job cooking to the correct temperature - I'm a loyal medium-rare burger fan and hate when its overcooked.  2) The bun - It has to be a soft bun as to not squish everything out, yet a slight toast to it.  3) The toppings - I'm a blue cheese and bacon burger fanatic and the quality of both here is excellent. 4) The fries - Can't forget the fries!!  They are the thinner version and cooked to a perfect crunchy perfection.

It's also a cute atmosphere and a very casual and cozy place to drop in for a quick meal.  If you love burgers done well, you'll love this place.
author: Philip D.

description:
Compared to other restaurants, its disappointing.

Compared to other "joints", its fancy.

Compared to other burger joints, it rocks.  The Neiman ranch is a welcome touch and the cheese steaks, well, they are making me FAT.

This place is the best at what it is, nothing more or less.
author: Ken p.

description:
Castillito is like 3 steps to the right. 

Poor Burgermeister must feel like a frumpy, pasty German girl standing next to the hottest latin MILF on earth.

Sucks to be Burgermeister.
author: merkley m.

description: Yo! They got some big ass burgers here! Western burger is my jam! The bypass surgery will be worth it, zero fucks son!
author: Thomas P.

description:
Yes, I get it, it's a funny pun, using the German word for mayor and implying that you're the best at slapping a patty of meat between two slices of bun.

Alas, they are not. Perfectly edible they are, but mastery is nowhere in sight.

I want to love you, and I do come in every once in a while, but always leave sort of fast-food-dissatisfied....

2 1/2 sad stars....
author: Tatjana G.

description:
One of my favorite places to get a burger. It helps that it's close to where I live; the one in Cole Valley would be even closer, but finding parking there is even worse than in the Castro.

The only items I ever get here are a Cheeseburger & Fries with Cheddar, the Buffalo Wings, and a Chocolate malt. So I can't speak for anything else. I like their burgers, they have always been consistently good. But the Buffalo Wings are just ok, nothing special.

The service is fine, the decor is cute Americana burger place, and the prices are stupid expensive. I was shocked the first time my wife and I ordered two cheeseburgers, one order of Buffalo Wings, one Chocolate malt, and the bill came out to over $40!! But apparently that doesn't stop people from patronizing them, and it doesn't stop me either. *shrug*
author: Adrian L.

description:
If you love garlic, get garlic fries here.  If you get a to go order people can smell the garlic from your box more that four feet from you.  Not just a slight scent, either.  If you walk four feet behind someone with an order of Burgermeister garlic fries it smells like you have a clove of fresh cut garlic up to your nose. Mmmm.  I love garlic.

The burgers are awesome.  Good thickness, have that flame broiled taste, and comes with all the fixin's on the side so if you are super picky there is no worry about the wrong things going on it.

They have fantastic people who work there and it always smells like enticing burgers when you walk by.

It's pretty expensive for a burger and fries, and they only take cash, but it's worth the flavor.
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
Yeah, it's really expensive... BUT it feels like you're eating good food made out of good ingredients. This is definitely the best burger joint within a short distance of my Hayes Valley apt.

The curly fries are really good, and the burgers are juicy and tasty. The burgers tend toward the medium or medium rare side, so that's something to be aware of if you don't like pink-in-the-middle burgers... which I actually love! Also, I enjoy these burgers more when I just order them plain or with cheese and then maybe I'll add pickles. They don't really need all the toppings/ fix-in's that a less tasty burger needs to boost otherwise sub-par flavor. Burgermeister also has a surprisingly delicious Cheese steak on the menu!
author: Liz W.

description:
Are you aware that one cow can make up to 900 Hamburgers?! You can learn this and much more at Burgermeister! Booyeah for bovines!!!

Conveniently located across from Safeway and next to El Castillito, this burger joint will fulfill all meat cravings for the whole family!
author: I Love Beef C.

description:
You know a burger is good when it takes enough napkins to kill a small forest to sop up the burger juice.

After a late night (well 10 is late for me) hanging out with friends, I was starving and trying to catch a cab home so that I could fix myself something to eat. With no available cabs for 5 or 6 blocks, I ended up eating at Burgermeister.

1 bacon cheese burger, fries and a root beer later; I limped home to nob hill with a stuffed stomach. The food totally hit the spot and the walk home did me a service too.
author: Brad C.

description:
Jesus Christ, $9.00 for a burger.  Well then, the patty better be hormone free, humanely raised, juicy beef, and weigh like half a pound.  Oh, it is, and you're throwing fries on the side, then we got a deal.

Any other time than when I'm actually eating one of their burgers I think that that is a ridiculously sized piece of beef, that's like two quarter pounders!  But when that wonderful juice is dripping down my chin, on my fingers and pooling at the bottom of the paper in my plastic tray, soaking into grilled onions and mushrooms, i know there is no way to stop myself from cramming every last cow morsel into my mouth, with that insane carnivorous tyrannosaurus grin on my face, hay maybe I'll have a second one (or maybe not eating for a day and a half).

Burgermeister is yet another one of those places that makes me wonder why in the name of all that is holy and good in the world do people go to chain fast food joints.  Sure you could spend $5.00 and be nicely fattened up somewhere else, but you get the mass produced crap that you pay for, made from evil clones of robotic cows and synthetic gerbil fibers.  People, stop believing commercials.

Will I pay $9 for another slice of burger heaven?  Hell yeah!
author: Adrian L.

description:
OK, we roll up to Burgermeister at 11:20pm on a Saturday night.  We passed up all the usual spots, Mythic Pizza, Castillito, etc.  Because what we want, what we NEED is deeeelicious (if over-priced) Burgers and Fries.  What?  WHAT'S THIS?  THEY'RE CLOSED?  BUT THE HOURS!  THEY ARE POSTED?  WHAT THE HELL, BURGERMEISTER.  BOOOO.  

Oh, p.s. cooks and cashiers, STOP LEERING.
author: Joanna R.

description:
If a burger place can be judged by the number of napkins I needed to get me through my meal, then this place gets 6 stars (napkins?).  Whoa, juicy, goodness.  

This place gets 4 stars because they are a "standard" burger joint that serves Nieman Ranch meat (read:  hormone-free, happy cows.  We like happy cows. Happy cows make happy people).  Their turkey burgers were not proclaimed happy, so I did not eat one.

The place was clean, the service was quick, parking was easy, they serve beer, our waitress told me & my boyfriend that we're charming, and all that put together equals:  BurgerMeister, we're charmed, and will be back.
author: Lopa V.

description:
To the Hell with the diet! and feel guilty later.
After to many commercials about healthy food, you get to a point that there is nothing left to eat, so i went back to basics and went for the adventurous journey for the origins of my manhood.
I had the right burger: well done (very juicy), nice extra fresh tomatoes, oh no onions, i had to work the next day, the ambiance is pretty cool, yellow mustard color on the walls make it perfect, the red hanging lights... hot, hot little place!
author: mossiwo m.

description:
Ok, my reviews are burger places are always going to be a bit skewed because I don't actually eat burgers.  I'm all about the grilled chicken sandwiches and the one served up here is pretty good, though nothing noteworthy. 

In fact, the only thing that really stood out was that I ordered a chicken sandwich with cheese, pre-made curly fries and soda and was charge 15 dollars for it. What the hell? It's chicken, dude. Knock that crap off.

When it comes to retro kitschy psuedo gourmet pricey fast food places in SF, I'd rather go to Burger Joint. Cheaper, fresh fries and coke instead of Pepsi.
author: jessica s.

description:
Gyarrrrrrrrrrrrr what a major RIP OFF! The food, notwithstanding the bill, is acceptable, but it's the ridiculous prices that totally taint the well. Thankfully, I only made the mistake of losing money to this joint one time. But in retrospect, that was one time too many.

If you must know what I ordered... I had a typical all-American burger with fries and onion rings, roughly the same quality as a $6.00 Slider's meal.
author: Daniel C.

description: I have upped my rating an extra star for their customer service, as I received nice apology from Burgermeister after my review.  I will at least give them a second chance.
author: James C.

description:
Oh Burgermeister, how I want to love you...I just don't think it's going to work out between us!

Burgemeister's burgers are good, they're just not great. They're lacking a certain soul. The meat was good but didn't wow me. The uniform patty reminds me of those 20-packs of hamburger patties from Costco. And don't think I'm convinced for a second that it's really Heinz ketchup you've got in those bottles. I'm on to you!
author: Michelle C.

description:
no lie.. the other night I spent 45$ on:

* 2 veggie cheeseburgers (both w/minimal toppings: blue cheese/avo/fried onlons)
* 1 order curly fries
* 1 order onion rings
* 2 beers

based on that alone i'll leave it up to you to make the decision to go there. 

insane.
author: Justin H.

description: I like this Burgermeister- it was really convenient before Blockbuster closed = /. Still, love this area and the staff is super friendly. Burgers are consistently good. I do agree it is a bit pricey.
author: Dana S.

description: I ended up here AGAIN because some friends insisted.  It's still terrible.  What makes eating there even worse now as opposed to my last visit is that Super Duper opened 2 blocks down Market street.  It's is 100x better and about 1/2 the price.  Don't get me wrong, I'd gladly pay $15 for a great burger (Mission Burger at Mission Bowl for example) but Burgermeister proves the old adage "location location location" because that is all it has going for it.   Go to Super Duper.  Every single item on the menu is better than Burgermeister's.
author: James G.

description: Although they didn't have the all-you-can-drink root beer floats like its sister store, the person who served us was kind enough to fill up the container with half ice cream so that we could refill it with root beer as many times as we wanted.  Decent burgers, but it's a bit pricey.  I only give it a 3 since my disappointment with the root beer and embarrassment from my friends (took them here since I thought all Burgermeisters were the same about the root beer) was rectified by the employee.
author: Carolen M.

description: Awesome avocado burgers are made here. Pricey, but fairly tasty. You also get heapfuls of fries, cole slaw or salad. Great place to eat this is out in front, but theres only 1 table, so you'll need to stake out. Burgers run a minimum of 10 bucks, but again, its worth it. I'd return to sample fish/chips, buffalo wings, and milkshakes.. Burgers are ready in about 10 minutes and they bring it out to you, so leave your coin change in the tip jar peeps..
author: Thomas L.

description:
Trendoid burger joint that rocks.

Sure, I've heard some bad mouth the trendy burger joint, in good old San Francisco fashion, on account of its...well...trendiness.  However,  the burgers here are just fantastic, and I love the fixings that they add to them: I like to add Chilli, Avacado, and Bacon myself.  The burgers are thick and juicy.  The fries are good, though I suggest going all the way with the Garlic or Seasoned Curly Fries.  They also have a good selection of beers on tap as well.   There is actually a good selection of vegi-burgers for vegetarians as well: including Bocca or Portabello Burgers.

Great extra selections and great burgers make this place...well...great.
author: Satoru Y.

description:
This place is a treat for me.  Getting older you realize the toll that a red meat diet may inflict upon your innards so you choose to limit your intake.

Its expensive.  Its over the top amounts.  They have all the accouterments.  Serving a beer is a major plus over the nearby BJ (Burger Joint).  Having a larger menu is a plus too.  My non red meat eating friends can find very tasty options here too. The decor is utilitarian and a little uncomfortable.  Lastly, the service is always a bit rushed but friendly.

I recommend highly.  What sucks is that I shop at Safeway nearby and the wonderful Burgermeister scents woft over to the parking lot...thereby always tempting me to increase my cholesterol.  Combined w/ El Castilito next door this is a mighty one-two punch to good fast food.
author: Chris D.

description:
Disclaimer: I will change my rating ONCE I actually eat a BURGER from this place.
