I had a hankering for a taco al pastor... but before I made it to the taqueria, I saw a sign saying "You've asked for it!  We now have CURLY FRIES".  

My mouth started watering for some curly fries... mmm smothered in ranch dressing, perhaps... I walked in, and it was a cute little dinerette of a place with some seating areas in the back.  I ordered my curly fries to go.  I perused their menus of expensive burgers (but they are made from "Niman Ranch" cows that are free of hormones and antibiotics... and the patties are half-pound apiece!)... then stopped when I saw "MALTS".  It was a bit pricey, but I was stressed as fuck and wanted to gorge on carbs, fats, carbs, and more fats.  I ordered the chocolate malt. 

The curly fries were standard.  The malt was not that malty... tasted more mocha than chocolate malt.  If you order in, they give you more food (you get that mixing canister of extra malt... and they overfill the basket of fries).  

My eyes were hungrier than my stomach.... but I will return for a burger next time.
author: Grace M.

description:
Really not the $8 burger experience I was hoping for.  The burger itself had too much of a charred/grilled flavor, to the point that I could hardly taste the deliciousness of Niman Ranch beef.  To add insult to injury, the bun, while not horrible by any stretch, was merely ordinary.  It's not the fancy, super-flavorful roll it ought to be to really compliment the burger.  The toppings at least are fresh & tasty.
The shake was actually even more disappointing - they use Mitchell's ice cream, which made me quite excited at first, but their chocolate shake is thoroughly doused in Hershey's syrup.  Whuah?  I'm sorry, but if I wanted a shake that tasted like Hershey, I wouldn't bother using Mitchell's.  What a waste.  I couldn't even tell it was Mitchell's, there was so much syrup in it.  Just use Mitchell's chocolate, and don't try and make it all fancy looking.
author: Don H.

description:
I've never eaten here, but they've cheerfully given me change for a dollar for MUNI so many times. Five stars for being good people.

Update 1/23/07: Um, five stars for being good people but three stars for the soggy-ass bun on my blue cheeseburger. The fries were good, though. I'll definitely go back. Someday. When my pants fit again.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Certified garden-burger enthusiast - Burgermeister has a nice one.

It's simple, cheap, and fast.

I will sometimes run over here after I shop for groceries at Safeway.

Recommend it, but I don't have too many details because the garden-burger w/the side salad is all I have ever had.
author: Lauren G.

description:
1.28.08

Had to edit and add a note about their garlic fries.  

Please, you must love garlic to order the garlic fries.  If you only like garlic and not love it, you will be sad that there is not a spattering of garlic and parsley on your fries but a dumptruck of the stuff.

I love garlic, so this is not a complaint and my review remains 5 stars deep.  This is just a warning.

***************************************************************************

My friend Ryan insisted that his last meal in the United States (well, for the next 3 years anyway) be at Burgermeister.

The last vestige of American cuisine he wanted to consume was a Turker Burger w/ Onion Rings and a milkshake.

Hands down, the best Turkey Burger in the city and aparently, the best Turkey Burger in the Unites States of freaking America.

He's off to Hong Kong for three years of dim sum and questionable meat.

Hats off to Burgermeister for it's no frills, all thrills, excellent fills American fare.
author: Jen I.

description:
This place holds my current spot for top burger in the city.  Though it seems a bit pricey for a burger joint, boy do they deliver.

My favorite burger to get here is the grilled onion and mushroom burger, but you also should give their Philly Cheesesteak a shot.  I'm usually not one for side upgrades, but OMG their onion rings are to die for.  Pair that up with a coke (or an excellent shake, as my roommate often does), and enjoy a blissful meal!

Gets extra stars for pleasant staff and a clean, pleasant interior.  

Beware, however, they don't accept credit cards!
author: Corey C.

description:
As the name might suggest, this place makes a pretty goddamned decent burger. I do like that you can certainly certainly customize the Niman Ranch goodness to just about any permutation you want, with different cheeses, toppings, and sauces. The curly fries are pretty satisfying as well, and I'm not that much of a curly fry guy.

However, the place certainly doesn't offer much for ambiance, and the cash-only rule is rather silly since, for a burger place, it can get a bit pricey.  I've also had other items here (hot dog, philly) that were pretty darned delicious as well. 

A good neighborhood spot to satisfy your carne cravings.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Overall Burger Rating- 7/10

Burger Choice: Bacon, Cheese, Onion Ring
Burger Temp: Medium Rare
Bun: Standard White
Fries Note(s): Curly Fires
Total Bill: $20 (Including a Beer)

Burger Notes:
Good burger. Nieman Meat. Could have been cooked a little more rare to be truly medium rare. Here's the thing: I felt that 20$+ dollars for a burger and a beer without being served by a waiter was a lot... I'd look elsewhere for a better burger at this price range, but if your in the area, then you'd certainly do worse for a fine burger.
author: Matt C.

description:
OK... all the OH MY GOD!  IT'S SO EXPENSIVE THAT THE BURGERS MUST BE MADE OF DIAMONDS!!  OH MY GOD!  CALL YOUR CONGRESSPERSON!!  I CAN'T EVEN GET A GRIP AT ALL I MUST TYPE IN ALL CAPS AND FREAK THE F%^ OUT ALL NIGHT ABOUT IT!! stuff?

Uh... can I just suggest starting out by getting a tiny grip, and working your way up?  Easy, people.  If you're getting the less expensive ones on the menu, there are fully five of them that are $8 or less.  For Niman Ranch beef, that ain't that out-of-hand.  Plus, it comes with the fries, which are extra at a lot of places.

And some of the people here are just lying, or remembering incorrectly (or shilling for their brother's franchise).  From the online menu:  A 1/3-lb Classic Burger, including fries and with tomatoes, pickle slices, lettuce and onions, costs $7 plus tax.  The Veggie Meister, too, is only $7, so whoever was claiming the veggie burger was more than that was incorrect.  $7.75 for a cheeseburger including fries.  $2.25 for a fountain drink.  The menu is available right online, anyone reading this can find that out for themselves with a few clicks.

Yes, that is more than In n Out Burger, or Carl's Jr., or Burger King.  But oh my gosh, if you have a friend who finds In n Out Burger better than this, don't trust them.  Not the best burger in town, but pretty great.  I realize that peace in the Middle East is easier than finding people who agree on the best SF burger place, but the bashing is unfair.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I'm a burger snob, and by calling themselves 'BurgerMeister' they are basically proclaiming to the world that they are masters of the hamburger. This is clever, because you can't get sued for false advertising when its just your name.

I have tried three burgers and every time I wonder what the fuss is about. The place smells great from outside, and the food looks good, but in the end you just paid out the arse for a mediocre to good burger. Nothing masterly about it. I tried the cheesesteak once too. That didn't work out so hot. This was additionally frustrating to me since Metro Caffe is two blocks away and has a pretty legit philly.

To be honest I wouldn't go back on my own, but if a friend really just had to have BurgerMeister because they are "ZOMG super rofl awesome", I would try to convince them otherwise and then grudgingly join them while trying to convince them to buy my meal.
author: Zac H.

description:
So the boyfriend and I, visiting from Seattle, drop in for a quick burger after returning a rented movie to Blockbuster. 
Everything looks really great, nice menu and pleasant service. Then after ordering two burgers and sodas, the cashier says 'That will be $33'. In unison we both asked if she was serious. She seemed kind of embarrassed and said 'the soda refills are free'. Ummm aren't they always? Oh yeah and then I noticed a tip jar (for counter service) which REALLY irritates me, but that's a different story. 

Our burgers were decent, above average for fast food counter service food but definitely NOT WORTH 33 dollars!! Someone needs to tell this place that we're in a recession. Of course I could have also read the menu prices before ordering. Too bad there won't be a next time.
author: Darrell S.

description:
First, forget the Church location (although it's open until Midnight). Head on over to the Cole location (which, sadly, is open until just 10.00 PM). 

It's a better view. Cuter staff. Better smiles. 

And, on to the food. I love hamburgers. I live on hamburgers. Hamburgers are like manna from heaven, and Niman Ranch burgers are pretty damn good. You can get the full size, or if you feel less glutonous, go for the kiddie's burger, which I did last week. Perfect size if you don't want to eat alot. And, the mushrooms and onions are grilled to a great state.

Best cole slaw I've had in the city so far. The french fries are just okay, but I'm more of a mushy fries or In-N-Out real fries type person. The onion rings are pretty damn good. Haven't ventured outside the burger motif, although the wings look good, and supposedly the cheesesteaks sell well. 

If you want a burger, you want beer, and you want (boo) Pepsi products, this is the place to go.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Burgermeister's pretty awesome. Their meat is really good and they bring everything to the table for you, which is cool.

$6.50 "Econo Lunch Special" gets you a 1/4 lb. cheeseburger, fries and a soda! Can't beat that!
author: Ali C.

description:
For a good ol' burger or a good Philly cheese steak sandwich,this joint really hits the spot right on .

Its not very big, but you can always get it to go. I had the Philly cheese steak and I enjoyed the good portion of meat and flavor of melted cheese and beef on a nice french roll. Yummy.the fries were nice and crispy and not too greasy either. I'll have to go back for the burgers, but from what I saw they looked awesome.
author: Dave S.

description:
Mama Like.

I love me some BurgerMeister.  They service Niman Ranch meats, have a great selection of dogs and sliders, and have the best buffalo wings this side of Market.  

My new favorite is the philly cheesesteak, which is done perfectly (at least on this coast).  Get the curly fries as an upgrade, they're worth it.

Only real downside for me is they only take cash.  I don't know about any of you, but i NEVER have cash on me and I just can't bring myself to use their ATM machine.  It's also a bit pricey, but I suppose standard for SF.

Happy eating.
author: louda l.

description: Having had a pleasant experience at this place a couple years ago, I returned last night and was crashingly disappointed. I ordered a half-pound cheeseburger, medium rare, with fries. To my dismay, Burgermeister's alleged half-pound patty is smaller than the 6 oz. patty at Joe's Cable Car in the Excelsior. As they say in the old country, WTF??? And my "medium rare" arrived well-done, dry and lifeless. When I want a really good burger, I'll stick with Joe's, which is closer to me anyway.
author: Bruce M.

description: Excellent California Burger! Delicious regular and curly garlic fries!! Mmmmmmmmmmm!
author: Mrs. Dawn H.

description: Average burger. Overpriced. $13 for a basic burger, fries and a coke. Get real.
author: K F.

description:
Bottom line: moderately expensive burger-joint where meat quality is fairly high, but assembly and coordination of flavors and greasiness leaves much to be desired. 

A few main points:
1) This is an expensive burger joint. And normally I'd be willing to pay more than $14 for a nice premium burger and a nice dish of fries. 

2) The burger meat was good. There were a few occasional patches of sinewy bits, but for the most part, my burger patty was cooked to a nice medium-rare and tasted pretty fantastic. Size was very large. 

3) Blue Cheese was too strong, Bun was too weak. Yes, this and the greasiness of the whole meal ruined the burger for me.
author: Fred C.

description:
You know when you get that rumbling in your tummy and it seems like only a burger and a beer can quell it?  If you're near the Castro, this location is convenient from the Church St. Muni stop (both the L and N lines) across from the Safeway.  They generally do their burgers medium-well it seems, so you should ask for medium-rare if you really want more juice in it.  However, I didn't find their burgers dry by any measure.  The cost is not cheap but you're getting Niman Ranch meat and it usually comes with a side of fries, slaw, or salad.  They don't have a lot of seating but I usually find it to be packed when I get there.

Times visited: 2
author: Amy L.

description:
As someone who doesn't eat red meat, I always thought this place was overpriced for a substandard veggie burger, even when pimped out with avocado and cheese. I had grown jaded from its overpriced mediocrity, and probably wouldn't even bother reviewing it.  However, recently, I have seen this place in a new light...

If you're a pescatarian who's not afraid of grease, skip the veggie burger offerings and go for the fish and chips instead.  After continuingly kicking myself for choosing the vegetarian burger options and being dissatisfied for far too long, I finally had the courage to switch it up and was glad I did.  Good fish to batter ratio and good tartar sauce made for a much more tastier meal than those of the faux meat variety.  By opting for the fish, I was finally able to realize all my greasy Burgermeister fantasies that were denied to me with all those dry, bland veggie patties.  Now, if they recreated their fries into something more spectacular, they would definitely earn one more star.  I'm going to step it up and try the curly fries next time.
author: Marie S.

description:
Yanno, it's tough to find a good consistent burger joint.  I come here for my burgers and I'm always quite full and satisfied after I eat a Bacon Cheeseburger with Fries.  They have good beer on tap too. 

I give these guys full props for making my stomach happy and I feel the 8 bucks is worth it.  You can waste that much at Burger King but honestly...taste this burger, it doesn't compare.

I don't recommend the Garlic Fries...it's not as good as it sounds.  

Fritz on Hayes has the BEST garlic fries btw...

Robble robble...
author: John M.

description:
Ya know, I've lived in San Francisco now for almost two years (not that long really, but in reality I've lived here longer than most people stay...so whatever bitches...) ANYWAYS! The reason I was starting with that "lovely introduction" is because I've lived here almost two years and have NEVER gone here before.

:O

Yeah, I know...shock face.

But I went last night and I enjoyed it very much. Their strawberry shake was delicious...Mitchell's Ice Cream can do that ya know. ;)

I got a bacon cheeseburger which was just "orgasm in my mouth" though the bun was a little greasey. This is definitely a "four - six napkin" kinda burger. I am guessing the Green Party wouldn't like seeing their trash can at the end of the night. :)

Check it out, it's tasty goodness. :)
author: Nicolas H.

description:
I eat 2 hamburgers a year.  I had one here.

It was ok.  Fries were good. Service is slow, especially if busy.

I like that you can add avo, bacon, etc.
author: David S.

description:
This is the type of place you chock up to this phrase: It is what it is.  I don't have many expectations of this type of place.  They specialize in burgers. 

Not 5-pound burgers.  Not $100 burgers.  Just burgers.  And fries.  And they have beer.  And a place to sit down.

I'd been here once before and got---well, I got a burger.  One with avocado on it.  It was fine.  Exactly what I expected.

We went there this weekend, and my husband's the one with the burger craving this time.  So, I get fish and chips.  I think it sounds good.

Yikes.  It was brown.  Inside and out.  And I couldn't cut the filets with my plastic fork and knife.  I had to wait for the grease to cool down before picking it up with my fingers.

I felt sick afterward.  And gross.  

My husband's burger did the trick, though.

The moral of the story is that if you crave a burger, this isn't a bad place to go.  If you want fish and chips, please avoid it.  

I feel bad giving them only 2 stars.  They seem like nice people, I think.  And it wasn't bad (for burgers).  I partly attribute the fact that I didn't like the fish and chips to making a mistake and ordering the item that isn't in the name of the restaurant.  But food quality assessment has to count for something, right?  And 2 stars is defined as -- "Meh.  I've experienced better."

And so I have.
author: Lori G.

description:
The only reason the place gets a 1 at all as opposed to a zero is because the milk shake was rather satisfying. 

Other than that, Ouch. I totally regret spending the $33 I could have used to buy wholesome groceries. 

Let me begin by saying that the San Diego burger was nothing special. It was a burger that tasted like the grill it was cooked on, gas and all. 

The worst part was the veggie (NEW) burger aspect of the meal. My girlfriend is a vegetarian. The patty was super mushy and had the consistency of sauteed vomit. It also was so strongly seasoned with rosemary that it just insulted my taste buds. Rosemary is a great herb that lends a savory hand, but overdone can ruin a dish. 
The ABSOLUTE WORST part was this mango sauce that accompanied the sweet potato fries. It was disgusting. 

I am convinced that a group of vegetarian hating jerks concocted these ideas. Please go back to the drawing board if you wish to make friends. 

I will not be back and I do not recommend it for anyone. Please spend your money wisely on groceries.
author: Dominico A.

description: Another $15 veggie burger place.  Skip it.  The food is always dry and expensive.  Go with the cheap burritos on either side.
author: Jonathan U.

description: Great place. Service was good. The owner even dropped by to ask how everything was going. I didn't have a burger but it looked pretty darn tasty! I had a bread bowl soup because I love calm chowder and its so very rare that restaurants have calm chowder. The chowder was absolutely delish. I will have to come back to try the bar and burger.
author: Cindy S.

description:
This is where I go when I want a hamburger. 

Quality beef  and it's cooked to juicy perfection. These burgers are HUGE, so go hungry or you may end up taking half of it home. I also love the onion rings here and the shakes are caloricious!
author: M O.

description:
They have a burger with mango on it, need I say more!  

Ok I will, everything tasted fresh and was yummy.  The price is very reasonable and the burgers are huge (come with an appetite).  The fries aren't that exciting; but with so much burger ~ who needs the fries.
author: Vikash G.

description:
Craving a burger in the city that rocks and wont break the bank? Burgermeister fills that void. And it's so much easier to get to than In-N-Out.

For ten bucks, you can get a beefy, juicy burger with all of the fixings (lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles) and your choice of french fries, cole slaw or spring salad mix. For a little bit more you can upgrade to garlic fries, chili fries, onion rings, curly fries, garlic curly fries or chili curly fries. Oh the possiblities.

I opted to get the avocado cheeseburger with garlic fries. Everything about my meal was awesome. The burger was huge, the fries were super tasty and the service was excellent.

I snuck a slurp of my boyfriend's vanilla milkshake and it was the bomb too. Kind of hard to NOT be the bomb since their milkshakes are made with Mitchell's ice cream.

I never really had burger cravings before, but from now on, I just might. Go BurgerMeister to fulfill that craving.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
This is the place for a fast burger fix. 

As you can tell from the other reviews it isn't a cheap burger fix but it's an old reliable.  Don't go if you don't want to smell like a burger afterwards.

The fries are good but could use more salt.  They have a good selection of beers and are very friendly about trading them out if yours doesn't taste fresh.

Lately I actually go more for the Neiman Ranch hot dog.  Be sure to order extra pickles.
author: Robert A.

description:
Really between 2.5-3 stars.

Very pricey, which means that it should have tasted better to receive more stars. Two Meister Burgers and a strawberry milkshake cost a little over $34.

We got take-out, and by the time we went back to the apartment, the food was kind of cold (it was about a 10 minute walk at most). The fries are decent (they're thick fries); my batch was still slightly crispy and slightly warm.

The burger itself has no condiments, so we had to add ketchup, mustard, and mayo ourselves. Poor take-out packing because they put the bun near the lettuce, so the bottom bun was soggy by the time we started eating. The mushrooms were a tiny bit salty to my liking. Though, all in all, it was a very decent burger...but not an amazing burger. Strawberry milkshake was tasty.

I'm not sure I'd spend this much again on a burger meal of this caliber (again, should have been better), but at least the meal was very filling. I made the mistake of eating the entire thing, half my fries, and practically my entire shake...it's been nearly 9 hours and I'm still kind of full and have some heartburn. =(

CASH ONLY.
author: Angela H.

description: For a standard burger joint, this is above average. No frills, no fancy, just a straight up burger the way you want it. Choice of quarter or half pound, selection of beef, turkey, or the fake stuff, and comes with a side of fries, cole slaw or salad. Not a bad meal, huh? I recommend trading in the regular fries for seasoned curly fries and if you're lucky, the server will whip out some ranch dressing from his pocket. Service was surprisingly friendly and attentive considering you just order at the counter and chow down. Solid work, Burgermeister, I'll be back!
author: Susan L.

description:
Fresh ingredients, immaculate presentation and friendly staff. Being totally unprepared and alone, I stupidly let the half-avocado and giant bun tip the flavour/texture balance away from beefy burgery goodness and more into sandwichville. 

Next time I will be more ready. Next time.
author: Glen M.

description:
No lasting impressions here. 

Ordered the Turkey Burger and ate it to not be hungry anymore. 

The burger is larger as it is meant to compete with restaurants. Did not like the "char-grilled" taste much, ketchup fixed that.
author: R S.

description:
I am a nut for blue cheese burgers. I know that beef is horrible for me and my arteries probably whimper every time I order one, but what can I say. Beef + Blue Cheese = Love.

The burgers here are great. The fries are good too. I wish the food didn't take as long to prepare, but I guess that good stuff takes time. It's totally worth the wait.
author: Kellie P.

description:
Ahh, Burgermeister! Better than Johnny Rockets? Uh probably!!! It was about two weeks ago that I came here wanting something filling. This being the weekend of the Fillmore Jazz Festival. I came in there dreaming of having one of their nice fat juicy burgers with a tall glass of something and poof the cashier killed that with "our grill insn't working." How lame!!! I came back a couple days later and felt like having some fish and chips. They were really good being that they are known more for their burgers. They don't just give you three big pieces of fish but several small pieces which I think is better. At least you don't burn your tongue as badly. I came out of here pretty satisfied, at least food wise.

The whole time I waited for my food the waitress/cashier was on her stupid cell phone text messaging someone or surfing the internet. The only time she actually did move was to bring someone something and then back to her phone. I thought this was very unprofessional and she looked totally bored out of her mind. The cook seemed to notice that I was watching this whole thing and took away her phone. Then she started whining and complaining about how she needed to call someone. Then he gave it back to her. Great if your employees whine like a little five year old you give them what they want? I really expected a whole lot more out of this place but this experience takes the cake. Yeah I'll go back but not for a while.
author: Alexandra A.

description:
They serve up some ginormous burgers here.  And they are a bit pricey.

Good fries, so-so onion rings and Pepsi products :-(

Unless you're one of those San Franciscans who runs around in a down jacket and scarf even when its in the 70s and 80s, don't eat here on a warm/hot day.  It gets roasting in here.
author: Jeff P.

description:
I'm a huge fan of burgers I must it's probably in the top 3 of my experiences here in SF dealing with burgers!!!
The people were nice great atmosphere and alot of bang for your buck!!!!
Definitely check it out!!!
author: Rich P.

description:
Arrgh! I'm going to need to learn to read my own reviews before I return to a place.

They still appear to have the secret surcharge ($10.22 on a $9 purchase). I checked both the wall menu and the to go menu and not a peep, although the to go menu (and not the wall menu) mentions an 18% service fee for groups. There is no excuse for this! If you're going to make this surcharge, be upfront about it!

The burn marks on my bocca burger tasted acrid and could not  be covered up by the A-1 steak sauce. If I wasn't so hungry I would have walked.

The only things I have good to say about this place are the condiments on the side and a generous serving of some pretty damn good cole slaw.
author: Charles B.

description: $9 sounds like a lot for a 1/2 lb burger, but considering that it's Niman Ranch meat, it ain't so bad after all. The fries, rings, and side items are cooked in fresh oil (you can tell because they're not gritty). Overall, a pretty decent deal of a meal.
author: Dan E.

description: Burgermeister is as good as they say. But it is also pricey and the burger size itself was a little unmanageable for me. But nevertheless, it is a tasty burger and they live up to the hype. I just wish my money went a little further there (wtf, cash only??)
author: Katie S.

description:
this place used to kick ass. And i say that as a vegetarian. However, they discontinued the avocado sandwich, and for that, i will never again return. it was so good, too, tasty slices of avo with sprouts and 2 kinds of melted cheese. mmm. They don't even have sprouts at all anymore, so you can't build your own! grr. 
one star for the fact that i saw robin williams and his creepy entourage there one night. the other star is for the 5 dollar shake, which is totally worth it. Travolta would approve. 
so if you like to eat tasty cows, go here (says my meat-eating friend B). if you're a veg, BOYCOTT THEM until they bring back the sprouts!!
author: lindsy g.

description:
In n' Out still sets the bar for burger places, but with Kelly's burgers having shut down, this is definitely your best bet in this area.

I know there's a ton of great reasons not to eat beef, but damn I don't think I could ever quit a good burger altogether.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Maybe I don't love Burgermeister because I tend to build up my expectations when I'm in the mood for a good burger.  I really wanted to love their food because it's so close to my apartment and of course there's always room in my life for more burgers....but they just do not deliver the goods.  

By 'the goods' I mean juicy, flavorful burgers that don't need a ton of toppings to taste like something.  Their burger meat is bland.  In fact, the best meal I've had at Burgermeister was their turkey burger.  I'm no purist, but a good ol' beef burger should be tastier than a turkey burger.

If I'm paying $8.65 for a cheeseburger it's gotta be bigger and bolder than what you get at In n' Out Burger.  Very average.
author: Billions S.

description: The burgers are very tasty but also very pricey. I hate the fact that it is an only cash establishment considering that you pay almost 10 bucks for a burger. Grilled mango and garlic burger a MUST try
author: Moy V.

description: Delicious food, made in decent timing and also really friendly and sanitary. I'm definitely glad I've ran into this place. Will definitely come back here whenever I'm close by. And they have tons of reviews as one of the greatest burgers and I couldn't judge since I ordered a Philly cheese steak which was also delish-ee-oh-so.
author: Chassidy M.

description:
Yummy burgers, much better than average. I had the reasonably priced lunch special today: a 1/4 burger with the standard fixings and cheese, regular fries and a drink for $8.16 with tax. The portion size of this special is more reasonable for those of us who can gain weight just by looking at food.

I still love In-N-Out or Fuddruckers as guilty pleasures, but this is about the best burger within a reasonable distance from home.
author: Michael M.

description:
Sadly, this Burgermeister is uneven- meaning some days you get a stellar burger and other days you wish you'd gone somewhere else. And they don't have a sliding scale- it's just as expensive when it's crappy.

Their Cole & Carl location is better. The staff does a fair amount of upselling but neither location has a register that shows you how much items are while you're ordering- you just get a verbal total, and they add their own special 'healthcare tax" which would be OK if you knew it was coming.
author: Rocco P.

description: I ordered the san francisco, had a hot dog with mushrooms and onions and a spring salad. I had no idea that the portions would be that huge and I tried my best to finish it all, however i ended taking the last of my portion home. This place is pricey, but the portions are great. I'm not sure if I could go into another Burger place because I work @ the counter. But for what it was, it was alright. Next time imma go big and get JUNK FOOD GALORE. haha
author: Lois R.

description:
Yes its expensive, but all the meat is from neiman ranch and from how great things taste its pretty clear that everything is quality. So i guess the bottom line is you get what you pay for.  

I  love the philly cheese steak and the fries.  

My one complaint is the wait.  I understand that everything is cooked to order, however the staff who is moderately friendly to slightly standoffish (is it just me or do most people in sf meet this description) do not really have  a "sense of urgency"

overall a solid choice for quality burger (beef, veggie, turkey etc...
author: Jimmy M.

description: Good burger, but not great and definately overpriced.  The fries weren't even hand cut and a beer is almost 6 bucks.  I don't think so Burgersheister.
author: Dan L.

description: I'm not into red meat much and if I have to eat it, I prefer buying good quality steaks or ground beef and making my own at the comfort of my home. However, I don't mind eating red meat once in a while being out and about. Burger Miester is one of my favorite places because they use Niman Ranch ground beef.  I've been to the Church street location many times, and so far, not been disappointed.
author: Marc N.

description: The high prices are justified by the fact they serve only Niman Ranch beef, meaning the burgers contain no nasty hormones, antibiotics, or preservatives. Other tasty options include a garden burger and an excellent grilled-chicken salad, both of which come with basic fries, although it's worth upgrading to the lemon-garlic variety. An old-fashioned milkshake completes a lunchtime meal that definitely will tide you over until dinner.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
Just went back to BM for the first time in ages... now I remember why it's been so long. If I wanted steamed burgers, I'd go to Burger King. And at $15/person without drinks, I could eat at Burger King three times. On top of it, they don't even take credit cards so their overpriced steamers require that you bring a Sherpa to pack in your cash.

Yuck. Why bother?
author: mike t.

description: No intentionality to our visit here -- it was across the street from Safeway.  Burgers were definitely tasty and grilled to order.  Fries were solid, beer was 3 bucks on tap.  Nothing to write home about, though.  Friendly service, clean eating area.
author: Brandon B.

description: It's not inexpensive and it IS a fast-food burger, but it does taste great. Nice char-grilled flavor and super tasty garlic fries. Order them crisp. Actually, ALWAYS order fies crisp or you'll most likely pay the price with some soggy-ass spuds. Burgermeister is fresh, they use Niman Ranch beef and it's damn tasty if you're feeling flush.
author: margot b.

description: This burger is not that good and definetly not worth the price.  I love burgers and have had toured the country in chase of the best burger.  This place wouldn't even make my top 100.  P.S. the fries are no good as well.
author: E M.

description: I cant recall how many times my boyrfriend and I have frequented this establishment.  Weither we were eating in or getting take out with the kitty, the food is the shit. Kind of pricey but overall good times!  Plus they have a shit load of condiments...
author: Tiphany P.

description: At night it's hard to find a table, but the burgers are really good and the onion rings are amazing. This isnt the place if you're into fancy burgers (you might want to try Barney's for that), but if you want a philly cheesesteak or a great mushroom burger, this place rocks. A dollar or two pricier than your average burgers though.
author: Jen Y.

description: So the chili cheese dog is HUGE.. probably 10 inches (that's what she said!). It was pretty good, except you have to eat it with a fork and knife because its damn near impossible to pick it up and shovel it into your mouth. I am a huge fan of garlic, normally. But, the garlic curly fries were not good.. maybe because they were completely covered in garlic. I think my breath still stinks.. Oh but the milkshakes are to DIE for! But $18 for a milkshake, fries, and  a chili dog??! YiKES
author: Sarah W.

description:
No!  I have been let down by Burgermeister and all of its favorable reviewers.  I was expecting something really juicy and good and it just wasn't that.  It had that old meat taste and it was dry.  The fries were just aight.  

The only thing I liked about it was the overly upbeat counter boy.  He asked my name for the order, and I said "jessica", and he goes "Ok Jessi, your order will be up soon!  Thanks a lot Jess!"  and then my boyfriend ordered next and he called him "stretch"...he he.  That's funny.

The true point of my review, however, is this: IN & OUT is far better than Burgermeister, far better than ANY burger place!!!!
author: Jessi C.

description: Been going here for years - one of the best veggie burger sin town - and I know my veggie burgers, believe me! They have both garden Boca! For the meat eating murderers, there's Niman ranch - the best going in the carnivore field. Excellent fries and great milkshakes. You can stay and get a seat by the window or (if you are really brave) get a seat outside and watch the Church and Market freaks go by as you munch on your heart-stopping fare. Or, my favorite trick,  you can get it to go and quickly down a pint or Fat Tire while you wait. Booze, burger, fries, and freaks - what else is there?
author: Kingpin X.

description: Fantastic burgers. What sets this apart from other places is their yummy buttery buns and un-runny cheese. And they know how to pack it in  - condiments & veg on the side so your burger doesn't get soggy (how I hate that).  I think the bitching about a 10 dollar burger is silly, if you want to pay .99 cents for a cheeseburger, hit up McDonald's. Or move somewhere cheaper. The ONLY problem here, my dears, is that their fries suck. I know that most restaurants use frozen fries, but can't they at least attempt to hide it better?
author: Maria D.

description: Worth the $8.00 and then some. Service was quick. The place is clean and not crowded at all and the staff is very friendly.
author: Teddy d.

description: This was an exceptional hamburger. Perhaps top 10 I've had. Good fries, too. But the prices? Damn. Good thing I was on vacation and pretending not to worry too much about spending money.
author: Tim L.

description: Decent burger.   A little too much 'char' taste going on.  Not worth 8 bucks (although that does include fries, which were good).   Do they make their patties fresh each day there?  because looking at the burgers on the grill that were cooking up, they looked suspiciously like pre-formed, frozen patties, which just happen to be made out of Niman-Ranch beef.  Too hot in there, too.  Good thing we had a delicious vanilla shake (made with Mitchell's ice cream, no less) to cool us off.  One extra star just for that.
author: Eileen H.

description: I LOVE BURGER MEISTER !Their burgers are good,I wouldnt say they are the best but they are good,great fries. I love the service ,they are always so nice and if there was ever a mix up on my order its never been a problem to fix it.I love that they know my name and are familiar with what I order. Im not crazy that the trash and condiments are so close together but Ive never got sick from that.I know the staff is clean because theyre always wiping everything down. So my final review they get a big ten.Ive just never had a bad experience there.I love the staff and I always go back there because I know what to expect GOOD SERVICE !!! Good Food !!
author: Kristo V.

description: These guys have great burgers, and a nice friendly atmosphere.  Are they the best burger in town?  Probably not.  But they are consistently very good, and nice and close to where I live.  If you're in the neighborhood check them out.  And don't be afraid to order one of the kids burgers.  I do all the time because the standard 1/3 pound burgers are just too big.
author: Dan S.

description: The burgers here are amazing.  Nothing fancy, just good old fashioned burgers.  Amazing onion ring!!  I also have to say that the people working there are always really friendly.
author: Sean O.

description: If you want the best mediocrity has to offer you found it.    It does the job but hey walk about 10 min more and you can have a 4.5 star at Burger Joint.  They add flavor and much better fries for $1 less!  Plus you gotta walk that thing off after you eat it to avoid burger all lodged up in your heart.  I guess the Meister is close to the train stop so it's convenient but I prefer to shorten my life with something delicious.
author: Jeff W.

description:
good burger joint and good hot wings.

but that being said one star taken away for stoped the half off hot wings day! VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED!

and one star off for...well I'll tell you the story.
i meet up with a friend for dinner i order the chicken fingers and she orders the veggie burger. everything is all good up until i bit into the 3rd chicken finger and its kinda tough to bit through. i think nothing of it, maybe just a tendon left in the chicken but as i finish biting it off, i look down and find that the chicken finger isn't cooked. its cooked on the outside but not on the inside. so i just go up and tell the guy at the counter that if he could cook it a little longer. he then shoots the cook that just happen to turn around this dirty look that almost translated too "you're fired!" anyways he asked if i wanted to order something else or get my money back. i ordered a burger.
author: Nate C.

description:
hands down the best $10 dollar burger i've had.

i swear it cures a hangover by the time you've finished it (or as much as your hungover self can muster)

avocado burger is the way to go. Half an avocado is on that massive burger.

done and done.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I have oftened wondered what Burgermeister was like as we walk past it often to one of our favourite comfort food restaurants, Home.  This time the call to action was spurred on by a hectic Friday night/Saturday morning.  After the dust had settled we decided that we needed to eat a hamburger or two.

Fortunately we had been given vouchers for a free burger (result!) so with that and a few dollars more in our pocket we stumbled out to Burgermeister.  I had decided in the car that no matter what, I was going to have a milkshake.  I rarely drink 'shakes because they are the most efficient fat and sugar delivery system known to man so when I do, I want it to be memorable.  I was happy to see that they make their shakes with the excellent Mitchell's ice cream, a local favourite and the shake did not disappoint.  In true fountain style the shake came in its own glass with the remainder served in a metal tumbler.  I took this as a sign from the burger gods that I was to make myself a coke float with the excess and both concoctions were seriously decadent.  If I had a slice of chocolate cake at the time, I'm pretty sure it would have ended up in the mix.  My vanilla shake was by far the highlight of the meal and lived up to everything it promised to be.

The burger and fries whilst not epoch making like the shake were also very nice indeed.  The patty was thick and juicy, well charred and came with a slice of proper cheddar, not processed.  The bacon could have been cooked more, I like my bacon crispy on a burger as a burger should always be a clean bite, so slightly chewy bacon did take it down a bit.  The fries, were fries, well seasoned and crispy.  I did look enviously at the diners next to me as they tucked into curly fries, how did I miss that!

Overall though I think Burgermeister is a solid four star joint, the burgers aren't that expensive at $6-8 a pop and the milkshakes make it worth the price of admission alone.  However if like me, you don't always take your meal with a 1200 calorie carbfest, I wouldn't make a special trip for Burgermeister.
author: Tony S.

description:
i ordered the san francisco burger (blue cheese and mushrooms).  the thing was huge and came with fries, but it was also pretty drippy (assuming it was liquid from the mushrooms), so my burger was really soggy.  soggy burgers = gross.
i guess besides that, everything was okay, tasty.  i think i prefer barneys over BM.
author: H. L.

description: In the ever ending search for the best burger in the city, once again I enjoyed it but was once again let down.  The burger was good, I am not going to lie to you, but not worth my 8-9 dollars.  I'll give them this much, there milk shakes are good, even great, and they have onion rings, always a plus in my book.  The sauted mushrooms were quite exquistie and they gave me an ample portion of blue cheese for my burger another bonus.  As I have said before, if you are in this neighborhood on a Tuesday and want a burger head up to Rosemunde's on Haight, between steiner and fillmore, next toranodo.
author: brian m.

description: I think this place has the best burgers in the city and has great onion rings,  but I'm always annoyed when a place doesn't take debit or credit cards.  You're a restaurant, pay the freakin' fee and extend some convenience to the customer.  Also, love the shakes and malts!
author: Kent C.

description:
The food here is OK, but the service is terrible. I walked in and was the only one there, ordered the chicken, I usually get a hamburger but wanted to try something different this time. I ordered at 2:10 and was the only person in there, by 2:25 other people had come in and ordered and I still hadn't gotten my food but I assumed it was because it was chicken so it would take a little longer to cook.  It's now 2:40, a half-hour later and i still hadn't gotten any food, while 2 people next to me were already eating. I go up to the counter and ask how much longer for the chicken. The guy behind the counter looks at me like I have 2 heads...."what chicken?"

Five years ago I probably would have ripped into this guy,  but I don't have time for that nonsense now, I just asked for my money back. He apologizes and says "Ya i see the order in here but I don't know what happened?".... oh you don't know do you?.... well let me tell you..."you forgot to tell the cooks, that's what happened."

Now before I get the "it was a mistake" line, ask yourselves.  Is it that hard to figure out something was wrong, I was the only person in there for 15 minutes, yet nothing was being cooked for anybody?

I will never go to this place again.... lost another customer.
author: SanFran C.

description:
When a group of about 30 of us strolled in 15 minutes before closing on a Sunday, I could tell that these Burgermeister employees were going to kill us. Instead, they were totally friendly and insisted we stick around. Sure they had to make 30+ burgers when they were so close to going home, but I think they made enough tip money to make up for it.

The food here is pretty good, but rather expensive. That aside, if you're looking for a good burger and don't mind paying a slight premium, this place ain't bad.

Also, don't believe the hype: This place is open from 11AM to 11PM, NOT midnight. They have a neon sign that says this in the window, but they have a door sign that reads 11AM to 12AM. A bit confusing but when I stopped by yesterday night at 11:15PM, they were definitely closed.
author: Alexis C.

description: 1/2 price wings on Monday, but make sure you have the time because they could take FOREVER!!  I got the chicken Philly and it was delicious..the fries (my favorite part of the meal) were crisped to perfection!  Just make sure you have time to spare because the wings took a good twenty to get ready,  but they did give my bro a free pint for the inconvenience.  All in all it was an enjoyable experience!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: I'm craving a burger right now...and if wasn't so late I'd drive across town to Burgermeister to get one.  A bit pricey, but it's high quality beef, so I don't feel bad feeding it to the kids. I always get the kid's meal, it's cheaper and I can't finish a whole quarter pound anyway. I've eaten plenty of burgers, and these are GOOD!
author: Ren V.

description: The conversation I had over lunch there went something like this.  "Mmmm, this a a great avocado bacon cheesburger" "Yeah but we just spend $30 on two burgers and two sodas".  Morale of the story: Great food, but a little on the pricey side.
author: Keith S.

description:
The following is a TRUE story - I wish it wasn't but it is!  I have been going to BugerMeister for years and they have good burgers.  They have terrible service - BEWARE!!! I did a take out order and they forgot the blue cheese (The whole reason I go there).  So I called the cashier and she says "I'll tape the receipt to the register -  just come in and we'll give you a burger on the house". 

You would think that would be the end of the story and then I'd be giving them a good review. NO - a few minutes later, the cashier calls back and says that she doesn't have the power to do that so the manager will call me tomorrow.  Next day someone calls and says that he wants to look into what went wrong. He wants to make it up to me and will call me back.  No one calls for a week. I decided to call them back.  I get the real manager  - he tells me that the person I talked to was a head cashier.  After way too much discussion, he tells me that he will give me a free meal.  It was like I was asking for his first born child.  Finally, case closed  - WRONG!! 15min later, he calls me back and says that I wasn't charged for the blue cheese so instead, he was going to give me 50% off my next meal. Well he is wrong - I'll never eat there again. It is too bad because they do have a descent burger but not worth the hassle.
author: Kevin C.

description: Food is excellent, service fast but alas I think a tad bit expensive especially on the sides. Please tell me why they can't offer either fries or onion rings as a standard side with my burger instead of charging me an additional $3.50 for the onion rings?
author: Maggie M.

description: Oh San Francisco, how I miss you. I distinctly remember the day when I came here to celebrate finishing the GMAT. Now I'm in school across the country, and sadly I can't eat here any more. The fries are ok (better than McDonalds), but the burgers are where its at. As other people mentioned, the food takes a while, but thats because they make your burger to order.
author: Dana L.

description: When I need massive onion rings topped with parmesan, I come here. It's the most bestest!
author: Alia D.

description: I like BurgerMeister, it isn't cheap but they give you a good amount of food and its high quality. They get their meat from Niman Ranch which is known for feeding their animals the food they re supposed to eat. Not the guts of other animals and hormones (read fast food nation). Which is important to me since I haven't eaten a burger at a fast food joint since 3 years ago. It's not somewhere to go if you're on a budget but definitely a good spot if you're date loves burgers.  In a nutshell, good food and you get what you pay for.
author: Catherine M.

description: Get the kids burger. Its 1/2 the size of the way too big regular burger but still totally fills you up. Don't be a pig...
author: A W.

description: I heard good things. I'd say OK. Garlic fries were yummy. The veggie burger was good, but I can make that myself. I guess meateaters would care more about this place..
author: Anita C.

description:
When I tutored my friend, I was torn between Burgermeister and a Burrito place I consistently went to, and I thought I wanted a Burrito, but luckily my friend persuaded me into eating a massive burger from Burgermeister, which could make anyone's day. Luckily , My friend and I had a coupon for a free burger, so the experience was that much sweeter. He got a Chili burger(little too cliche') , while I got the Avacado chicken burger. The food was beyond what Ive expected and I believe Thats the place to be to get a semi-quick burger. Atmosphere was excellent, the walls are full of pictures and Articles of interesting events. The price was *NOT* right. The Price may be the only thing that may avert you from here, but dont let that fool you, lots of people bag on this place, but I think its a wonderful place for a burger. BUT there are other really good places to eat such as Flipper's down near Hayes and Laguna. 

Food 5/5
Atmosphere 4/5
Price 3/5

Word of mouf: Just experience it first.
author: Jimmy K.

description: I have to admit it was awhile ago that I ate here but I still hear wonderful things from everyone I know who lives around there. Bacon cheeseburger is all I have to say. It may clog your arteries but so worth it!
author: Jessica K.

description:
San Francisco has, in a way, ruined me. Despite my midwestern upbringing, I just don't eat much meat anymore. But when I do get that craving for a serious hamburger, this is where I go. The portions are ample, the food is good, and the staff are great, sharp and friendly.

My favorites are the Western Burger (with, I swear, onion rings right on it) and the Mango Burger. The garlic fries are yummy and half-buried in garlic. And the chocolate malts are out of this world.

The only real drawback is that the place is crazy expensive. I always have to stop myself from asking, "Are you sure?" when they give me my change. And given the prices, you'd think they could afford take credit cards, rather than making people spend another couple of bucks to use their in-house ATM.

But heck, for a once-a-month meaty indulgence, I can forgive them.
author: William P.

description: By far my favorite BURGER joint............The best meat, fries, malts....... not too trendy but not trashy either....It's a bit pricey but well worth it!  A burger, fries and malt will run you about $15 bucks...but worth it!
author: Blake J.

description:
it's hard to write a review about this place.  generally, i think the food is good.  i went there the other night with my girlfriend and got a veggie burger.  with all the toppings it came out to $12.  a little on the high side.  the service was good.  the young guy working there was very helpful to my girlfriend.  i think he wanted her for dinner.  i mean litterly.  helpful, but the drool coming from his mouth wasn't.  learn to contain yourself little boy or was this the first time you have seen a pretty woman?  wait, this is SF and the women here look like dudes.  so, i excuse you this time.  oh the food...  this time the veggie burger was great.  

however, i know all the complaints about the fat manager guy.  last time we went in there something like 8 months ago, he totally screwed up the order.  the burger was crap and he had major attitude towards us.  i'm sorry loser manager man/idiot, but you might want to find a different job where you don't have contact with customers.  maybe you should try being a greeter at folsom prison.
author: T D.

description: Good natural beef.  I like just about everything here, even the steak sand which.  My favorite is a bacon cheese burger with either swiss or pepper jack.  Good, but tame roasted garlic fries.  They saute the garlic first, so it makes it a little mild for my taste.  Hefty at 1/2 pound, they will set you back about $8, and $3 for garlic fries.  If you want mayo, you have to ask for it.  Not many places to sit, but it is not very crowded.  Supposedly they are opening a joint in Westlake Mall.  Enjoy!
author: Michael M.

description: This sure is a tasty burger.  I like this place because the burgers are actually not as greasy as most burger places.  It's on a cool part of Church where you can sit outside and it's not too busy.
author: Mitch A.

description: There is no better place to cure a hangover than Burgermeister! They even have a dope happy hour to go with your garden burger with bacon, cheese and avocado. Not to forget the fries. I think this place has some of the best chicken wangs eva! And let me tell you pizza and "wangs" are my thing. For a full meal with beer included your looking at about nine or ten bucks. Don't forget to tip the kind people who are curing your hangover.  You will be thanking them in an hour or so.
author: monika l.

description: There is something to be said for Niman Ranch beef and it is: Mmmmmm!  Consistently great burgers and cheesesteaks everytime even though it has a frat hang out atmosphere.  At least it's in the Castro which tones it down a bit.
author: Jill D.

description: I good burger. A good shake. Very good slaw. Very expensive. But at least the burger was cooked to order and the staff was friendly. A solid middling review.
author: William N.

description: Amazing Burgers!  A few friends from school and I decided to stop here and grab some food to take to Dolores park.  The staff was super friendly and the food, nothing short of the best!  Large portions, fresh ingredients, the only draw back would be the price.  Loves it!
author: Sean M.

description: Great for veggie burgers too, with several veggie patty options.  Really filling, satisfying.  Right across the street, Safeway stocks Tums, in case you over did it.
author: Ryan L.

description: So good : The cheese burger are delicious,  and the fries arent half bad either.  Try getting your burger with a salad,  it's still totally filling but you get out of having post-carb guilt.
author: Matt G.

description: The burger tasted great. However i'm giving this place 3 stars simply because i feel like the price for a burger and soda shouldn't be over $10. The portions are great though. I'm just stuck on the high price. If this place just dropped its prices by like a dollar it would have 4 stars from me.
author: Jeff C.

description: The price is a tad bit high, but they are very convenient and make for a no-frills stop prior to shopping at Safeway. (That way you are too full to entertain all those cheesecakes and cookies that you shouldn't buy anyway.) My favorite is the avocado/cheese. Not gourmet, but quite tasty. I also kind of like the way the staff seems to care less if you eat there or not -- not rude, just sort of preoccupied. That way you don't feel too self conscious about ordering the fries and a big ass soda.
author: Robert M.

description:
Love the philly chicken and cheese, western burger, california burger, etc., always with curly fries.  Very solid menu.

Always characters at this location, and my meal usually includes some form of entertainment.

On food alone...I'd give this place 4 stars.  However the fact that for 2 people, a philly chicken sandwich, drink, and curly fries nearly costs $40, minus a star.  This place has earned the nickname "really expensive burger place".  But every now and then I'm willing to shell it out.
author: James L.

description: They make a damn good burger here. Pretty good selection of cheeses, combos, and sides. Even silly veggie burgers. All their meat is Nieman Ranch beef, and you can tell the quality in each decadent, grease oozing, eyes rolling bite. Get a pint of Fat Tire ale to do some washing down. Make sure you grab a seat outside so the crusty, jobless gutter punks can see what paying for your own food is all about.
author: Mick F.

description: I've lived next to this place for a couple of years now. I've never been a huge fan of the burgers (they just taste funny to me) but the Philly Cheese steak, Chicken Cheese steak, Chips & Strips, and Chicken burger are all great. The foods always hot and the service always friendly & helpful. The only problem is its all a little expensive, but I guess thats just the neighborhood (I'm a fan of Sparkies but I do NOT love paying $10 for a club sandwich).
author: Jeff S.

description: It's funny cuz I've passed this place a million times but have never thought to go in and try anything.  But thanks to my hairdresser being late I was able to step inside after erasing the chalkmarks from my tires(hey he was late DPT would understand). Ok I have to admit the place is a bit pricey and the customer service was a little short on the service but the food was AMAZING.  I had a Grilled chicken breast sandwich and garlic fries, the grilled chicken breast was huge and delicious and the garlic fries were what heaven would taste like sopped in ketchup.  They also have all sorts of cool veggie dishes, like grilled mango and pineapples and they even serve portabello sandwiches.  I'll definitely be stopping by to check out the rest of the menu and get my grub on.
author: Marie B.

description: Im not a big burger eater and I have been to this location as well as the one in Cole Valley and the food is pretty good.  On the expensive side for a burger but hey, it's SF.
author: Denny R.

description: I've given this place my fare share of tries and have had enough. Overcooked, overpriced, oversized. Will not ever return.
author: M L.

description: This is truly the best burger place in SF. Portions are great, garlic fries are to die for, and in a wonderful neighborhood. Good luck on finding parking though because it's a true challenge at times.
author: David M.

description: Best burger in the city.  Chemical free beef topped with fresh avacado and some cheddar cheese mmmmmmmmm.  Throw in your fountain beverage of choice and it's fancy fastfood heaven.   Shakes are really good too.  More spendy than a trip through drive through but sometimes you really do get what you pay for and this would be one of those times.
author: Valerie D.

description:
oh, tasty tasty bleu cheese and bacon burger, you are so luscious!

burgermeister is AWESOME! reasonably priced (for what it is), beer AND my friends and i have shown up in a group of about 20 and they seem pretty cool about it.

plus, theyre right around the corner from me.
author: Ameigh F.

description: I went here one morning after a wild night of drinking, dancing and smoking.  Needless to say I was a little worse for wear.  Then I walked into this Mecca and got a bacon/avacado burger, onion rings, vanilla milk shake, and soda.  Oh my God, it was sooooo delicious.  I couldn't get enough of it.  I want more just thinking of it, you have to go!
author: Lynn S.

description: It's actually worth it to take the N up to the Cole Valley Burgermeister HQ. Same burgers, but the atmosphere is waaay nicer.
author: robin s.

description: K, I always wanted to try this place, saw all the great reviews. Too dam hot in this place. maybe I just picked the wrong day to go. Buffalo Wings...spicy n vinegary and NO MEAT...Burger...nice size but I can taste the burnt grill...service good...but even the employees were complaining how hot it was in there.
author: Dee D.

description:
a tasty burger, and some other good options, too.  the last couple of visits i've been into the philly cheese steak, both the chicken and beef varieties.  the bread is a little too thick and the sandwich would benefit from some peppers, but i'm just grousing.  goddamn is that ever a tasty sandwich.

the burgers are good as well, of course.  my only gripe is that they're all so friggin' huge.  sometimes i feel like being a glutton and scarfing down a whole half-pound burger, but sometimes a 1/4- or 1/3-pounder will do.  they get big bonus points in my book for using antibiotic-free beef.  if they can promise me all grass-fed beef, i'll gladly pay $12 a burger and eat here twice as often.
author: Jeff W.

description: pain in the ass its only cash only but hey welcome to pain in the ass san francisco. The burgers are pretty darn good, I preferred kellys(RIP) , but this will do and its walking distance to my house so I'll deal. Their nieman ranch bacon bugs me...not that im supposed to be eating that in all my jewish glory , but, when I get a yen for a baconburger I cant deny myself... maybe this spot is too gourmet for me? Mitchells Ice cream milkshakes tho! BOOYAH
author: Lauren V.

description:
When I have the money to splurge on a $10 burger, $6 shake and some delicious garlic fries this is where I go.    I probably eat here about once a month and love their garlic fries.  

Good place to stop and get a quick bite.
author: Serena T.

description: Good but not great.. Friendly service.. Great happy hour deals.. Shake was really good
author: Shauna P.

description: This place has three kinds of veggie burgers (Garden, Boca, and Portobello), great fries, and beer on tap!  yum!
author: Shelley G.

description: Good burger selection, but the pricing is tad steep. They don't take credit cards, but have ATM in-store. Good location for people watching and solid selection of beers in tap.
author: Steve B.

description:
this is a great burger place as you will see by all the awards it has won, its convienent, usually quick, the burgers are made to order so always delicious.. the crew there is friendly.. i guess they have to be since their patrons are usually stumbling in for a drunken bite.. or is that just the gf and I.. hmmm... 
anyways the only thing that stopped me from giving this five stars is the prices are on the higher end of the spectrum.. i mean worth it, yeah maybe... but still paying 30 bucks for two burgers and some fries seems a little too much...!
author: jamie z.

description: More casual than Flipper's (in Hayes Valley).  Burgermeister does a great veggie burder and has a nice casual atmosphere and is very quick.
author: Carrie L.

description:
damn you burger-meister.. you ruined all other burgers around the city for me.. when a juicy tasty burger comes to mind, burger meister comes to mind and then i have to start looking for the one closest to where i am... i am telling you that is just wrong and unfair....
others deserve a chance too.. but oh well... this one is bookmarked so is always available ;)
author: hardik k.

description: Last night I went to Burgermeister because I had a coupon for a free burger.  Coupons for free things always get me in the door of a place, even if the food is less than spectacular.  The thing about this place is that I know it's good, but I really don't have anything to say about it.  It's a cheeseburger done right and the fries aren't soggy.   The hipster kids working there are nice and one can always find a table.  I wish I had more to say and that there was more inspiration to warrant extensive use of adjectives, but there isn't.
author: Sarah H.

description: What's not to love!  The burgers are great,(I had an avocado, swiss cheese burger, well-done), the fries are crisp, and the cashier kept calling me by my name (always a nice touch).  There was also music from late 70's , early 80's playing in the background. ..."tempted by the fruit of another..." (Sorry!)  It couldn't be more perfect.
author: Carlos C.

description: If you crave for burger after a hard day at work or hard workout  at the gym this is a place to go.  You can have it to go or eat in. their burgers are good and the atmosphere is friendly and very nice service.
author: Jay I.

description: Such a delicious burger!  A big patty cooked juicy made it worth the extra few bucks for this burger.  Fries were perfection, and I liked the cole slaw a lot.  Cool vibe.
author: Ellen P.

description: I rarely eat burgers, but when I get a craving..this is the only place I'll go...delicious!
author: City G.

description: This would probably get my vote for the best burger joint in the city if it wasn't for the fact that it's somewhat overpriced.  The burger itself if a beautiful thing.  Huge, juicy, cheesy...it's probably the best tasting burger I've had in the city.  And the fries are awesome too.  Garlic fries, spicy curly fries, spicy garlic curly fries, you name it, they got it, and they're good!  But, like I mentioned before, by the time you've got a succulent bacon-cheeseburger, spicy garlic curly fries, and a nice cold Anchor Steam sitting in front of you, you've already put down close to $20, so it's not exactly a good deal.  But make no mistake, Burgermeister makes one helluva burger, probably the best in the city, just depends if your willing to pay the price.
author: Zach J.

description: I went here for the first time and was pleasantly surprised how good it was.  I am a Sliders fan, but this place was even better and about the same price.  I ordered the 1/2 cheeseburger and fries and it was excellent.  The quality of the meat made a big difference between this burger and Sliders'.  The fries were about the same quality although I think I liked this a bit better.  They were a bit thinner and fresher then Sliders'.  My friend ordered the Vegan burger and salad and she thought it was excellent as well.  Overall I thought it was great and I would go back again
author: Brian K.

description: I love Burgermeister it's pretty much the only organic thing I put in my body and that's only because it doesn't taste like classic organic fare i.e. sprouts and tofu and doesn't blow my budget.  Usually I say all things are better in the Castro but the one in Cole Valley is esthetically so much better.
author: Kris J.

description:
2 boca burgers and 2 curly fries - $25.00. Seriously?!? Yup. Seriously. 

Were they totally delicious? Nope, the burgers tasted like gas from the grill, and fries were kind of chewy - heat lamp chewy.  

Did you have a beer, soda, avocado on the side that up'e the price?
No, just the burgers and fries.

Was it organic, free-range, hormone free? 
Boca always is. Shouldn't be any more expensive than any other restaurant. 

Were the curly fries cut and seasoned by virgins during a full moon? From the taste, I'd say ask CostCo, but I don't think so.  

Is the place run entirely on newly installed solar panels? 
I think not. 

Will you be going there again? 
That's a no. I'll keep Sliders in mind next time I need that burger and fries fix.
author: C. W.

description:
cash only 
and
not nearly as good as kelly's

fries are iffy

and burger topping selection is not nearly as plentiful

that said,
it's far above mcdonald's
perhaps on par with in n out
but ask someone who eats beef
author: Eva S.

description:
incredible french fries.  but pepsi?!?!  come on.  

the burgers are ok.
author: Eric L.

description: I had heard about Burgermeister from a lot of people and everybody tells me its the best in the city. So I naturally didn't believe them until I had a chance to try it. I went there the other day and had a bacon cheddar burger. It was a bit pricey for a burger but after I had a taste I personnaly thought it was well worth it. Great Place ....Try It!!!
author: Ray A.

description: Ok, so after reading the reviews before I'm a little confused.  I Like this burger joint.  I've eaten here twice now.  Both times I thought to myself jeesh I'm paying over 10 bucks for a burger.  BUT, I came back.  This place is close to work and the service/food have been good/(not great).  However, in this city I'll give an extra star for consistency.  The burger was sizeable, and the fries were hot.  I left satisfied, and I'll be back.
author: J.D. H.

description: Burger with really good beef flavor, cooked medium rare as requested, nice bun, good condiments, very good onion rings (not greasy), and ice cold Stella on tap.  If you are in this area, or even if not, the total package is touch to beat.  Pricey?  Not really when one considers the high quality product.
author: Bob M.

description: I think this might be the best burger I've ever had.  Oh and best onion rings ever.  The meals are pretty expensive but soo worth it.
author: Max P.

description: i always stick to the same old burger and fries here at burgermeister. $8 niman burger is a fine burger. and i love the garlic fries. some are saying the $8 is too much for what you get. but i agree with another reviewer and you are paying for the niman ranch beef. free of hormones, antibiotics, or preservatives. i feel what i am getting is a hot and fresh tasting half pound burger. i live between this burgermeister and big mouth burger in the mission. if i'm hungry from home i will probably go to big mouth. but if i have to go to safeway i have no problem stopping at burgermeister.
author: roger b.

description: went to burgermeister and spent $10 on a burger. the question isnt whether the burger was good.. because it was pretty motherF*ing good, but the real question is whether or not it was worth being broke after spending 10 motherF*ing dollars on a hamburger... and then having to blow a fat truck driver behind safeway for bus fare to get home... hhhmmmm... debatable
author: N. B. K.

description: great burgers...even better with curly fries.  although there is no way i can't finish the burger because it's so fing good, but i always feel like someone is going to need to roll me home.  so, there's what i discovered.  their kid's burger has everything the normal burger has, it's just about 2/3 of the size.  and it's also cheaper.  voila!  i don't feel like i need to make myself vomit and i have a little cash to spare.  it's a win-win situation!
author: Jessica W.

description: A good burger and a good milk shake. Nothing more, nothing less. A 3, bordering on 3 and 1/2.
author: John Paul N.

description: Very nice service. Cash only? ok.  $11.35 for a frozen boca burger and fries with cheese on an orowheat bun and no drink,? I questioned why I was being charged for a 1/2 pound burger, when I ordered a boca burger.  The 1/4 lb is 2 dollars less. From looking at the pack of burgers I have in my fridge, a boca burger weighs 0.22 lbs.  So  from a quick calc, I am paying $11 for what amounts to maybe $2 in food. WTF, arent' we in a recession? Why people would ever rate this place more than 3 stars is beyond me.  Go to Chow or Metro Burger on Fillmore for better food or cheaper prices for the same food, respectively.  Despite the good service I am giving this 1 star to counter the 5 star reviews, The food probably rates 3 stars. I will not go back until they have reasonable prices.
author: Darryl D.

description: All-around most reliable burger experience in town.  The wussily misnamed "kid's burger" gives you a less-overwhelming quarter-pound option when you just don't feel up to the challenge of the half-pound standard burger.  I'd steer clear of all the toppings, including all the hokey-jokey California-style mangos and pineapples and all that crap, because it detracts from the flavor of the beef, which is always excellent.   With all these burger joints using Niman Ranch beef and other high-grade chuck, one starts looking for the other details to separate the champion burgers from the pretenders.   Burgermeister offers the best fries of any local burger joint I've tried... If you want to snazz up your burger and don't want to goof around with all the crazy toppings they offer, get a side of chili fries.  The chili is top quality and really augments the flavor of the fries and burger.  The shakes here are great too.  The chicken tenders are dissapointing.   Also, the Cole Valley location offers an amazing "econo lunch special," of a 1/4 pounder, fries and soda for a total of $6.50...a great deal, especially compared to ridiculously over-priced competitors like "Burger Joint" on Haight & Pierce.
author: Dan L.

description: Burgermeister is expensive for a burger joint but you get what you pay for. YMMV, especially if you're not a vegetarian like me, but for my money, these guys make the best burgers on the continent--some goes for their onion rings, actually. They also have a fairly decent selection of beers and window seats which make good people-watching. And they're sympathetic to the various dietary requirements that people I go there with have. Definitely five stars.
author: Mik S.

description: It may taste great, but the prices are ridiculous! As soon as the prices went up to $40 for two people, I refuse to go there! Refuse! Just go next door for a burrito instead.
author: Bethany J.

description: The burgers are just "ok".  Not really worth 8 bucks each.  But the reason for the 4 stars was the service.  VERY friendly people work here and made up for the average food.  Location isn't too bad either.
author: James B.

description: i'm so cute, i think i'm like such a party-er passing this place on the way to the train stop to go home.  i stumble down the steps and am like 'starved' from drinking all day.  anyway, it's like only 10:30pm and i ask for an order of fries to sober my red face up, and they are yummy!  the order came quick with the service so friendly they ask you what you name is!  potato-ey fries mm mm good!  so i started early, what.
author: Monk R.

description: We started out at the Carl Street Burgermeister- got a parking spot half a block away - I was thinking this is too good to be true!  We get to Burgermeister and they inform us their fryers are down. WHAT?  A hamburger with no fries?  That's unthinkable!  So we head to the Church Street Burgermeister.  We park practically in front of the place - I'm thinking this is too good to be true - their fryer will probably be down too.  But nope - we check that out first thing and it's up and running.  Alrighty.  We get down to the serious business of ordering and when that is said and done they ask for $46.  The next sound they hear is my jaw hitting the counter.  $46 for three hamburgers, fries, one water, one Diet Pepsi and one beer.  AWK!  Oh - and put the plastic away - they only take cash.  While I'm trying to get past the shock of paying the $46, we find a table and we sit down and wait.  Cute decor - comfotable little place.  After a short wait the food is brought to the table - and one forgets the pain of paying $46.  Great hamburger - good meat really does make a difference.  Nice fresh pickle and great fries!   The only thing left on my plate by the time I was done was the lettuce leaf and part of the red onion.  And I was full the rest of the day and didn't eat again so really that hamburger wasn't so expensive after all was it?!   Well that's how I justify it anyway.   I'm headed back there next time I want a good hamburger.
author: Cindy D.

description: we go here when we really want chili's but don't want to/can't justify driving all the way to San Bruno for a burger and fries, i had high hopes for the portabello burger but it was too dry, this place charges for a slice of cheese... bad form Burgermeister, bad form.
author: Jared Z.

description: Another restaurant that proves when you take good, fresh ingredients and cook them for your customers (not before!), even fast food can be a wonderful eating experience. Niman Ranch burgers piled high with fresh lettuce, juicy red tomatoes, and other toppings of your choosing makes these burgers a comfort-food find! They tend to cook their burgers a little past what you've ordered, so order one step below your perfect burger...
author: Michael H.

description: good veggie burger. good curly fries. good shakes. big portions. make sure you're hungry. ps. try combining their bbq sauce with mayo for a nice little dipping sauce for your fries.
author: James J.

description: there really is a distinct difference between good and bad meat.  burgermeister never disappoints with it's quality beef, and it's the first go-to food for absorbing that last drink you know might put you over the toilet the next day...
author: regina k.

description: never had the burger, but i've had the buffalo wings!  every wednesday is .50 cent buffalo wings special, minimum 6 wings.  they have daily specials for each day of the week.
author: Pickle R.

description: First off, I have to say, they have AWESOME fries.  But when I came in last night, all I wanted was a hotdog.  They said I couldn't order just a hotdog--I had to order a whole meal.  What a joke.  $7.35 for a hotdog meal.  It's cheaper at Metreon or the ballpark.  How can you not be able to order just a hotdog?  It's not like I came in asking to order just a slice of tomato.  Oh well.  I went next door and got two delicious tacos for $5.
author: IMHeAsURHe B.
